38# Note: Some test cases are run twice: once normally and once with labeled data 

39# These two must be defined in the same test function or need to have 

40# different baseline images to prevent race conditions when pytest runs 

41# the tests with multiple threads. 

42 

43 

44def test_get_labels(): 

45 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

46 ax.set_xlabel('x label') 

47 ax.set_ylabel('y label') 

48 assert ax.get_xlabel() == 'x label' 

49 assert ax.get_ylabel() == 'y label' 

50 

51 

52@check_figures_equal() 

53def test_label_loc_vertical(fig_test, fig_ref): 

54 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

55 sc = ax.scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=[1, 2]) 

56 ax.set_ylabel('Y Label', loc='top') 

57 ax.set_xlabel('X Label', loc='right') 

58 cbar = fig_test.colorbar(sc) 

59 cbar.set_label("Z Label", loc='top') 

60 

61 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

62 sc = ax.scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=[1, 2]) 

63 ax.set_ylabel('Y Label', y=1, ha='right') 

64 ax.set_xlabel('X Label', x=1, ha='right') 

65 cbar = fig_ref.colorbar(sc) 

66 cbar.set_label("Z Label", y=1, ha='right') 

67 

68 

69@check_figures_equal() 

70def test_label_loc_horizontal(fig_test, fig_ref): 

71 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

72 sc = ax.scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=[1, 2]) 

73 ax.set_ylabel('Y Label', loc='bottom') 

74 ax.set_xlabel('X Label', loc='left') 

75 cbar = fig_test.colorbar(sc, orientation='horizontal') 

76 cbar.set_label("Z Label", loc='left') 

77 

78 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

79 sc = ax.scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=[1, 2]) 

80 ax.set_ylabel('Y Label', y=0, ha='left') 

81 ax.set_xlabel('X Label', x=0, ha='left') 

82 cbar = fig_ref.colorbar(sc, orientation='horizontal') 

83 cbar.set_label("Z Label", x=0, ha='left') 

84 

85 

86@check_figures_equal() 

87def test_label_loc_rc(fig_test, fig_ref): 

88 with matplotlib.rc_context({"xaxis.labellocation": "right", 

89 "yaxis.labellocation": "top"}): 

90 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

91 sc = ax.scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=[1, 2]) 

92 ax.set_ylabel('Y Label') 

93 ax.set_xlabel('X Label') 

94 cbar = fig_test.colorbar(sc, orientation='horizontal') 

95 cbar.set_label("Z Label") 

96 

97 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

98 sc = ax.scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=[1, 2]) 

99 ax.set_ylabel('Y Label', y=1, ha='right') 

100 ax.set_xlabel('X Label', x=1, ha='right') 

101 cbar = fig_ref.colorbar(sc, orientation='horizontal') 

102 cbar.set_label("Z Label", x=1, ha='right') 

103 

104 

105@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

106def test_acorr(fig_test, fig_ref): 

107 np.random.seed(19680801) 

108 Nx = 512 

109 x = np.random.normal(0, 1, Nx).cumsum() 

110 maxlags = Nx-1 

111 

112 ax_test = fig_test.subplots() 

113 ax_test.acorr(x, maxlags=maxlags) 

114 

115 ax_ref = fig_ref.subplots() 

116 # Normalized autocorrelation 

117 norm_auto_corr = np.correlate(x, x, mode="full")/np.dot(x, x) 

118 lags = np.arange(-maxlags, maxlags+1) 

119 norm_auto_corr = norm_auto_corr[Nx-1-maxlags:Nx+maxlags] 

120 ax_ref.vlines(lags, [0], norm_auto_corr) 

121 ax_ref.axhline(y=0, xmin=0, xmax=1) 

122 

123 

124@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

125def test_spy(fig_test, fig_ref): 

126 np.random.seed(19680801) 

127 a = np.ones(32 * 32) 

128 a[:16 * 32] = 0 

129 np.random.shuffle(a) 

130 a = a.reshape((32, 32)) 

131 

132 axs_test = fig_test.subplots(2) 

133 axs_test[0].spy(a) 

134 axs_test[1].spy(a, marker=".", origin="lower") 

135 

136 axs_ref = fig_ref.subplots(2) 

137 axs_ref[0].imshow(a, cmap="gray_r", interpolation="nearest") 

138 axs_ref[0].xaxis.tick_top() 

139 axs_ref[1].plot(*np.nonzero(a)[::-1], ".", markersize=10) 

140 axs_ref[1].set( 

141 aspect=1, xlim=axs_ref[0].get_xlim(), ylim=axs_ref[0].get_ylim()[::-1]) 

142 for ax in axs_ref: 

143 ax.xaxis.set_ticks_position("both") 

144 

145 

146def test_spy_invalid_kwargs(): 

147 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

148 for unsupported_kw in [{'interpolation': 'nearest'}, 

149 {'marker': 'o', 'linestyle': 'solid'}]: 

150 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

151 ax.spy(np.eye(3, 3), **unsupported_kw) 

152 

153 

154@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

155def test_matshow(fig_test, fig_ref): 

156 mpl.style.use("mpl20") 

157 a = np.random.rand(32, 32) 

158 fig_test.add_subplot().matshow(a) 

159 ax_ref = fig_ref.add_subplot() 

160 ax_ref.imshow(a) 

161 ax_ref.xaxis.tick_top() 

162 ax_ref.xaxis.set_ticks_position('both') 

163

165@image_comparison(['formatter_ticker_001', 

166 'formatter_ticker_002', 

167 'formatter_ticker_003', 

168 'formatter_ticker_004', 

169 'formatter_ticker_005', 

170 ]) 

171def test_formatter_ticker(): 

172 import matplotlib.testing.jpl_units as units 

173 units.register() 

174 

175 # This should affect the tick size. (Tests issue #543) 

176 matplotlib.rcParams['lines.markeredgewidth'] = 30 

177 

178 # This essentially test to see if user specified labels get overwritten 

179 # by the auto labeler functionality of the axes. 

180 xdata = [x*units.sec for x in range(10)] 

181 ydata1 = [(1.5*y - 0.5)*units.km for y in range(10)] 

182 ydata2 = [(1.75*y - 1.0)*units.km for y in range(10)] 

183 

184 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

185 ax.set_xlabel("x-label 001") 

186 

187 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

188 ax.set_xlabel("x-label 001") 

189 ax.plot(xdata, ydata1, color='blue', xunits="sec") 

190 

191 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

192 ax.set_xlabel("x-label 001") 

193 ax.plot(xdata, ydata1, color='blue', xunits="sec") 

194 ax.set_xlabel("x-label 003") 

195 

196 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

197 ax.plot(xdata, ydata1, color='blue', xunits="sec") 

198 ax.plot(xdata, ydata2, color='green', xunits="hour") 

199 ax.set_xlabel("x-label 004") 

200 

201 # See SF bug 2846058 

202 # https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&aid=2846058&group_id=80706&atid=560720 

203 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

204 ax.plot(xdata, ydata1, color='blue', xunits="sec") 

205 ax.plot(xdata, ydata2, color='green', xunits="hour") 

206 ax.set_xlabel("x-label 005") 

207 ax.autoscale_view() 

208 

209 

210def test_funcformatter_auto_formatter(): 

211 def _formfunc(x, pos): 

212 return '' 

213 

214 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

215 

216 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

217 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

218 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

219 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

220 

221 ax.xaxis.set_major_formatter(_formfunc) 

222 

223 assert not ax.xaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

224 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

225 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

226 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

227 

228 targ_funcformatter = mticker.FuncFormatter(_formfunc) 

229 

230 assert isinstance(ax.xaxis.get_major_formatter(), 

231 mticker.FuncFormatter) 

232 

233 assert ax.xaxis.get_major_formatter().func == targ_funcformatter.func 

234 

235 

236def test_strmethodformatter_auto_formatter(): 

237 formstr = '{x}_{pos}' 

238 

239 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

240 

241 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

242 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

243 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

244 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

245 

246 ax.yaxis.set_minor_formatter(formstr) 

247 

248 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

249 assert ax.xaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

250 assert ax.yaxis.isDefault_majfmt 

251 assert not ax.yaxis.isDefault_minfmt 

252 

253 targ_strformatter = mticker.StrMethodFormatter(formstr) 

254 

255 assert isinstance(ax.yaxis.get_minor_formatter(), 

256 mticker.StrMethodFormatter) 

257 

258 assert ax.yaxis.get_minor_formatter().fmt == targ_strformatter.fmt 

259 

260 

261@image_comparison(["twin_axis_locators_formatters"]) 

262def test_twin_axis_locators_formatters(): 

263 vals = np.linspace(0, 1, num=5, endpoint=True) 

264 locs = np.sin(np.pi * vals / 2.0) 

265 

266 majl = plt.FixedLocator(locs) 

267 minl = plt.FixedLocator([0.1, 0.2, 0.3]) 

268 

269 fig = plt.figure() 

270 ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1) 

271 ax1.plot([0.1, 100], [0, 1]) 

272 ax1.yaxis.set_major_locator(majl) 

273 ax1.yaxis.set_minor_locator(minl) 

274 ax1.yaxis.set_major_formatter(plt.FormatStrFormatter('%08.2lf')) 

275 ax1.yaxis.set_minor_formatter(plt.FixedFormatter(['tricks', 'mind', 

276 'jedi'])) 

277 

278 ax1.xaxis.set_major_locator(plt.LinearLocator()) 

279 ax1.xaxis.set_minor_locator(plt.FixedLocator([15, 35, 55, 75])) 

280 ax1.xaxis.set_major_formatter(plt.FormatStrFormatter('%05.2lf')) 

281 ax1.xaxis.set_minor_formatter(plt.FixedFormatter(['c', '3', 'p', 'o'])) 

282 ax1.twiny() 

283 ax1.twinx() 

284 

285 

286def test_twinx_cla(): 

287 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

288 ax2 = ax.twinx() 

289 ax3 = ax2.twiny() 

290 plt.draw() 

291 assert not ax2.xaxis.get_visible() 

292 assert not ax2.patch.get_visible() 

293 ax2.cla() 

294 ax3.cla() 

295 

296 assert not ax2.xaxis.get_visible() 

297 assert not ax2.patch.get_visible() 

298 assert ax2.yaxis.get_visible() 

299 

300 assert ax3.xaxis.get_visible() 

301 assert not ax3.patch.get_visible() 

302 assert not ax3.yaxis.get_visible() 

303 

304 assert ax.xaxis.get_visible() 

305 assert ax.patch.get_visible() 

306 assert ax.yaxis.get_visible() 

307 

308 

309@pytest.mark.parametrize('twin', ('x', 'y')) 

310@check_figures_equal(extensions=['png'], tol=0.19) 

311def test_twin_logscale(fig_test, fig_ref, twin): 

312 twin_func = f'twin{twin}' # test twinx or twiny 

313 set_scale = f'set_{twin}scale' 

314 x = np.arange(1, 100) 

315 

316 # Change scale after twinning. 

317 ax_test = fig_test.add_subplot(2, 1, 1) 

318 ax_twin = getattr(ax_test, twin_func)() 

319 getattr(ax_test, set_scale)('log') 

320 ax_twin.plot(x, x) 

321 

322 # Twin after changing scale. 

323 ax_test = fig_test.add_subplot(2, 1, 2) 

324 getattr(ax_test, set_scale)('log') 

325 ax_twin = getattr(ax_test, twin_func)() 

326 ax_twin.plot(x, x) 

327 

328 for i in [1, 2]: 

329 ax_ref = fig_ref.add_subplot(2, 1, i) 

330 getattr(ax_ref, set_scale)('log') 

331 ax_ref.plot(x, x) 

332 

333 # This is a hack because twinned Axes double-draw the frame. 

334 # Remove this when that is fixed. 

335 Path = matplotlib.path.Path 

336 fig_ref.add_artist( 

337 matplotlib.patches.PathPatch( 

338 Path([[0, 0], [0, 1], 

339 [0, 1], [1, 1], 

340 [1, 1], [1, 0], 

341 [1, 0], [0, 0]], 

342 [Path.MOVETO, Path.LINETO] * 4), 

343 transform=ax_ref.transAxes, 

344 facecolor='none', 

345 edgecolor=mpl.rcParams['axes.edgecolor'], 

346 linewidth=mpl.rcParams['axes.linewidth'], 

347 capstyle='projecting')) 

348 

349 remove_ticks_and_titles(fig_test) 

350 remove_ticks_and_titles(fig_ref) 

351 

352 

353@image_comparison(['twin_autoscale.png']) 

354def test_twinx_axis_scales(): 

355 x = np.array([0, 0.5, 1]) 

356 y = 0.5 * x 

357 x2 = np.array([0, 1, 2]) 

358 y2 = 2 * x2 

359 

360 fig = plt.figure() 

361 ax = fig.add_axes((0, 0, 1, 1), autoscalex_on=False, autoscaley_on=False) 

362 ax.plot(x, y, color='blue', lw=10) 

363 

364 ax2 = plt.twinx(ax) 

365 ax2.plot(x2, y2, 'r--', lw=5) 

366 

367 ax.margins(0, 0) 

368 ax2.margins(0, 0) 

369 

370 

371def test_twin_inherit_autoscale_setting(): 

372 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

373 ax_x_on = ax.twinx() 

374 ax.set_autoscalex_on(False) 

375 ax_x_off = ax.twinx() 

376 

377 assert ax_x_on.get_autoscalex_on() 

378 assert not ax_x_off.get_autoscalex_on() 

379 

380 ax_y_on = ax.twiny() 

381 ax.set_autoscaley_on(False) 

382 ax_y_off = ax.twiny() 

383 

384 assert ax_y_on.get_autoscaley_on() 

385 assert not ax_y_off.get_autoscaley_on() 

386 

387 

388def test_inverted_cla(): 

389 # GitHub PR #5450. Setting autoscale should reset 

390 # axes to be non-inverted. 

391 # plotting an image, then 1d graph, axis is now down 

392 fig = plt.figure(0) 

393 ax = fig.gca() 

394 # 1. test that a new axis is not inverted per default 

395 assert not ax.xaxis_inverted() 

396 assert not ax.yaxis_inverted() 

397 img = np.random.random((100, 100)) 

398 ax.imshow(img) 

399 # 2. test that a image axis is inverted 

400 assert not ax.xaxis_inverted() 

401 assert ax.yaxis_inverted() 

402 # 3. test that clearing and plotting a line, axes are 

403 # not inverted 

404 ax.cla() 

405 x = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 100) 

406 ax.plot(x, np.cos(x)) 

407 assert not ax.xaxis_inverted() 

408 assert not ax.yaxis_inverted() 

409 

410 # 4. autoscaling should not bring back axes to normal 

411 ax.cla() 

412 ax.imshow(img) 

413 plt.autoscale() 

414 assert not ax.xaxis_inverted() 

415 assert ax.yaxis_inverted() 

416 

417 # 5. two shared axes. Inverting the master axis should invert the shared 

418 # axes; clearing the master axis should bring axes in shared 

419 # axes back to normal. 

420 ax0 = plt.subplot(211) 

421 ax1 = plt.subplot(212, sharey=ax0) 

422 ax0.yaxis.set_inverted(True) 

423 assert ax1.yaxis_inverted() 

424 ax1.plot(x, np.cos(x)) 

425 ax0.cla() 

426 assert not ax1.yaxis_inverted() 

427 ax1.cla() 

428 # 6. clearing the nonmaster should not touch limits 

429 ax0.imshow(img) 

430 ax1.plot(x, np.cos(x)) 

431 ax1.cla() 

432 assert ax.yaxis_inverted() 

433 

434 # clean up 

435 plt.close(fig) 

436 

437 

438@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

439def test_minorticks_on_rcParams_both(fig_test, fig_ref): 

440 with matplotlib.rc_context({"xtick.minor.visible": True, 

441 "ytick.minor.visible": True}): 

442 ax_test = fig_test.subplots() 

443 ax_test.plot([0, 1], [0, 1]) 

444 ax_ref = fig_ref.subplots() 

445 ax_ref.plot([0, 1], [0, 1]) 

446 ax_ref.minorticks_on() 

447 

448 

449@image_comparison(["autoscale_tiny_range"], remove_text=True) 

450def test_autoscale_tiny_range(): 

451 # github pull #904 

452 fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 2) 

453 for i, ax in enumerate(axs.flat): 

454 y1 = 10**(-11 - i) 

455 ax.plot([0, 1], [1, 1 + y1]) 

456 

457 

458@pytest.mark.style('default') 

459def test_autoscale_tight(): 

460 fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

461 ax.plot([1, 2, 3, 4]) 

462 ax.autoscale(enable=True, axis='x', tight=False) 

463 ax.autoscale(enable=True, axis='y', tight=True) 

464 assert_allclose(ax.get_xlim(), (-0.15, 3.15)) 

465 assert_allclose(ax.get_ylim(), (1.0, 4.0)) 

466 

467 

468@pytest.mark.style('default') 

469def test_autoscale_log_shared(): 

470 # related to github #7587 

471 # array starts at zero to trigger _minpos handling 

472 x = np.arange(100, dtype=float) 

473 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(2, 1, sharex=True) 

474 ax1.loglog(x, x) 

475 ax2.semilogx(x, x) 

476 ax1.autoscale(tight=True) 

477 ax2.autoscale(tight=True) 

478 plt.draw() 

479 lims = (x[1], x[-1]) 

480 assert_allclose(ax1.get_xlim(), lims) 

481 assert_allclose(ax1.get_ylim(), lims) 

482 assert_allclose(ax2.get_xlim(), lims) 

483 assert_allclose(ax2.get_ylim(), (x[0], x[-1])) 

484 

485 

486@pytest.mark.style('default') 

487def test_use_sticky_edges(): 

488 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

489 ax.imshow([[0, 1], [2, 3]], origin='lower') 

490 assert_allclose(ax.get_xlim(), (-0.5, 1.5)) 

491 assert_allclose(ax.get_ylim(), (-0.5, 1.5)) 

492 ax.use_sticky_edges = False 

493 ax.autoscale() 

494 xlim = (-0.5 - 2 * ax._xmargin, 1.5 + 2 * ax._xmargin) 

495 ylim = (-0.5 - 2 * ax._ymargin, 1.5 + 2 * ax._ymargin) 

496 assert_allclose(ax.get_xlim(), xlim) 

497 assert_allclose(ax.get_ylim(), ylim) 

498 # Make sure it is reversible: 

499 ax.use_sticky_edges = True 

500 ax.autoscale() 

501 assert_allclose(ax.get_xlim(), (-0.5, 1.5)) 

502 assert_allclose(ax.get_ylim(), (-0.5, 1.5)) 

503 

504 

505@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

506def test_sticky_shared_axes(fig_test, fig_ref): 

507 # Check that sticky edges work whether they are set in an axes that is a 

508 # "master" in a share, or an axes that is a "follower". 

509 Z = np.arange(15).reshape(3, 5) 

510 

511 ax0 = fig_test.add_subplot(211) 

512 ax1 = fig_test.add_subplot(212, sharex=ax0) 

513 ax1.pcolormesh(Z) 

514 

515 ax0 = fig_ref.add_subplot(212) 

516 ax1 = fig_ref.add_subplot(211, sharex=ax0) 

517 ax0.pcolormesh(Z) 

518 

519 

520@image_comparison(['offset_points'], remove_text=True) 

521def test_basic_annotate(): 

522 # Setup some data 

523 t = np.arange(0.0, 5.0, 0.01) 

524 s = np.cos(2.0*np.pi * t) 

525 

526 # Offset Points 

527 

528 fig = plt.figure() 

529 ax = fig.add_subplot(autoscale_on=False, xlim=(-1, 5), ylim=(-3, 5)) 

530 line, = ax.plot(t, s, lw=3, color='purple') 

531 

532 ax.annotate('local max', xy=(3, 1), xycoords='data', 

533 xytext=(3, 3), textcoords='offset points') 

534 

535 

536def test_annotate_parameter_warn(): 

537 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

538 with pytest.warns(MatplotlibDeprecationWarning, 

539 match=r"The \'s\' parameter of annotate\(\) " 

540 "has been renamed \'text\'"): 

541 ax.annotate(s='now named text', xy=(0, 1)) 

542 

543 

544@image_comparison(['arrow_simple.png'], remove_text=True) 

545def test_arrow_simple(): 

546 # Simple image test for ax.arrow 

547 # kwargs that take discrete values 

548 length_includes_head = (True, False) 

549 shape = ('full', 'left', 'right') 

550 head_starts_at_zero = (True, False) 

551 # Create outer product of values 

552 kwargs = product(length_includes_head, shape, head_starts_at_zero) 

553 

554 fig, axs = plt.subplots(3, 4) 

555 for i, (ax, kwarg) in enumerate(zip(axs.flat, kwargs)): 

556 ax.set_xlim(-2, 2) 

557 ax.set_ylim(-2, 2) 

558 # Unpack kwargs 

559 (length_includes_head, shape, head_starts_at_zero) = kwarg 

560 theta = 2 * np.pi * i / 12 

561 # Draw arrow 

562 ax.arrow(0, 0, np.sin(theta), np.cos(theta), 

563 width=theta/100, 

564 length_includes_head=length_includes_head, 

565 shape=shape, 

566 head_starts_at_zero=head_starts_at_zero, 

567 head_width=theta / 10, 

568 head_length=theta / 10) 

569 

570 

571def test_arrow_empty(): 

572 _, ax = plt.subplots() 

573 # Create an empty FancyArrow 

574 ax.arrow(0, 0, 0, 0, head_length=0) 

575 

576 

577def test_arrow_in_view(): 

578 _, ax = plt.subplots() 

579 ax.arrow(1, 1, 1, 1) 

580 assert ax.get_xlim() == (0.8, 2.2) 

581 assert ax.get_ylim() == (0.8, 2.2) 

582 

583 

584def test_annotate_default_arrow(): 

585 # Check that we can make an annotation arrow with only default properties. 

586 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

587 ann = ax.annotate("foo", (0, 1), xytext=(2, 3)) 

588 assert ann.arrow_patch is None 

589 ann = ax.annotate("foo", (0, 1), xytext=(2, 3), arrowprops={}) 

590 assert ann.arrow_patch is not None 

591 

592 

593@image_comparison(['fill_units.png'], savefig_kwarg={'dpi': 60}) 

594def test_fill_units(): 

595 import matplotlib.testing.jpl_units as units 

596 units.register() 

597 

598 # generate some data 

599 t = units.Epoch("ET", dt=datetime.datetime(2009, 4, 27)) 

600 value = 10.0 * units.deg 

601 day = units.Duration("ET", 24.0 * 60.0 * 60.0) 

602 dt = np.arange('2009-04-27', '2009-04-29', dtype='datetime64[D]') 

603 dtn = mdates.date2num(dt) 

604 

605 fig, ((ax1, ax2), (ax3, ax4)) = plt.subplots(2, 2) 

606 

607 ax1.plot([t], [value], yunits='deg', color='red') 

608 ind = [0, 0, 1, 1] 

609 ax1.fill(dtn[ind], [0.0, 0.0, 90.0, 0.0], 'b') 

610 

611 ax2.plot([t], [value], yunits='deg', color='red') 

612 ax2.fill([t, t, t + day, t + day], 

613 [0.0, 0.0, 90.0, 0.0], 'b') 

614 

615 ax3.plot([t], [value], yunits='deg', color='red') 

616 ax3.fill(dtn[ind], 

617 [0 * units.deg, 0 * units.deg, 90 * units.deg, 0 * units.deg], 

618 'b') 

619 

620 ax4.plot([t], [value], yunits='deg', color='red') 

621 ax4.fill([t, t, t + day, t + day], 

622 [0 * units.deg, 0 * units.deg, 90 * units.deg, 0 * units.deg], 

623 facecolor="blue") 

624 fig.autofmt_xdate() 

625 

626 

627def test_plot_format_kwarg_redundant(): 

628 with pytest.warns(UserWarning, match="marker .* redundantly defined"): 

629 plt.plot([0], [0], 'o', marker='x') 

630 with pytest.warns(UserWarning, match="linestyle .* redundantly defined"): 

631 plt.plot([0], [0], '-', linestyle='--') 

632 with pytest.warns(UserWarning, match="color .* redundantly defined"): 

633 plt.plot([0], [0], 'r', color='blue') 

634 # smoke-test: should not warn 

635 plt.errorbar([0], [0], fmt='none', color='blue') 

636 

637 

638@image_comparison(['single_point', 'single_point']) 

639def test_single_point(): 

640 # Issue #1796: don't let lines.marker affect the grid 

641 matplotlib.rcParams['lines.marker'] = 'o' 

642 matplotlib.rcParams['axes.grid'] = True 

643 

644 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(2) 

645 ax1.plot([0], [0], 'o') 

646 ax2.plot([1], [1], 'o') 

647 

648 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

649 data = {'a': [0], 'b': [1]} 

650 

651 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(2) 

652 ax1.plot('a', 'a', 'o', data=data) 

653 ax2.plot('b', 'b', 'o', data=data) 

654 

655 

656@image_comparison(['single_date.png'], style='mpl20') 

657def test_single_date(): 

658 

659 # use former defaults to match existing baseline image 

660 plt.rcParams['axes.formatter.limits'] = -7, 7 

661 dt = mdates.date2num(np.datetime64('0000-12-31')) 

662 

663 time1 = [721964.0] 

664 data1 = [-65.54] 

665 

666 fig, ax = plt.subplots(2, 1) 

667 ax[0].plot_date(time1 + dt, data1, 'o', color='r') 

668 ax[1].plot(time1, data1, 'o', color='r') 

669 

670 

671@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

672def test_shaped_data(fig_test, fig_ref): 

673 row = np.arange(10).reshape((1, -1)) 

674 col = np.arange(0, 100, 10).reshape((-1, 1)) 

675 

676 axs = fig_test.subplots(2) 

677 axs[0].plot(row) # Actually plots nothing (columns are single points). 

678 axs[1].plot(col) # Same as plotting 1d. 

679 

680 axs = fig_ref.subplots(2) 

681 # xlim from the implicit "x=0", ylim from the row datalim. 

682 axs[0].set(xlim=(-.06, .06), ylim=(0, 9)) 

683 axs[1].plot(col.ravel()) 

684 

685 

686def test_structured_data(): 

687 # support for structured data 

688 pts = np.array([(1, 1), (2, 2)], dtype=[("ones", float), ("twos", float)]) 

689 

690 # this should not read second name as a format and raise ValueError 

691 axs = plt.figure().subplots(2) 

692 axs[0].plot("ones", "twos", data=pts) 

693 axs[1].plot("ones", "twos", "r", data=pts) 

694 

695 

696@image_comparison(['aitoff_proj'], extensions=["png"], 

697 remove_text=True, style='mpl20') 

698def test_aitoff_proj(): 

699 """ 

700 Test aitoff projection ref.: 

701 https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib/pull/14451 

702 """ 

703 x = np.linspace(-np.pi, np.pi, 20) 

704 y = np.linspace(-np.pi / 2, np.pi / 2, 20) 

705 X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y) 

706 

707 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 4.2), 

708 subplot_kw=dict(projection="aitoff")) 

709 ax.grid() 

710 ax.plot(X.flat, Y.flat, 'o', markersize=4) 

711 

712 

713@image_comparison(['axvspan_epoch']) 

714def test_axvspan_epoch(): 

715 import matplotlib.testing.jpl_units as units 

716 units.register() 

717 

718 # generate some data 

719 t0 = units.Epoch("ET", dt=datetime.datetime(2009, 1, 20)) 

720 tf = units.Epoch("ET", dt=datetime.datetime(2009, 1, 21)) 

721 dt = units.Duration("ET", units.day.convert("sec")) 

722 

723 ax = plt.gca() 

724 ax.axvspan(t0, tf, facecolor="blue", alpha=0.25) 

725 ax.set_xlim(t0 - 5.0*dt, tf + 5.0*dt) 

726 

727 

728@image_comparison(['axhspan_epoch'], tol=0.02) 

729def test_axhspan_epoch(): 

730 import matplotlib.testing.jpl_units as units 

731 units.register() 

732 

733 # generate some data 

734 t0 = units.Epoch("ET", dt=datetime.datetime(2009, 1, 20)) 

735 tf = units.Epoch("ET", dt=datetime.datetime(2009, 1, 21)) 

736 dt = units.Duration("ET", units.day.convert("sec")) 

737 

738 ax = plt.gca() 

739 ax.axhspan(t0, tf, facecolor="blue", alpha=0.25) 

740 ax.set_ylim(t0 - 5.0*dt, tf + 5.0*dt)

743@image_comparison(['hexbin_extent.png', 'hexbin_extent.png'], remove_text=True) 

744def test_hexbin_extent(): 

745 # this test exposes sf bug 2856228 

746 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

747 data = (np.arange(2000) / 2000).reshape((2, 1000)) 

748 x, y = data 

749 

750 ax.hexbin(x, y, extent=[.1, .3, .6, .7]) 

751 

752 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

753 data = {"x": x, "y": y} 

754 

755 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

756 ax.hexbin("x", "y", extent=[.1, .3, .6, .7], data=data) 

757 

758 

759@image_comparison(['hexbin_empty.png'], remove_text=True) 

760def test_hexbin_empty(): 

761 # From #3886: creating hexbin from empty dataset raises ValueError 

762 ax = plt.gca() 

763 ax.hexbin([], []) 

764 

765 

766def test_hexbin_pickable(): 

767 # From #1973: Test that picking a hexbin collection works 

768 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

769 data = (np.arange(200) / 200).reshape((2, 100)) 

770 x, y = data 

771 hb = ax.hexbin(x, y, extent=[.1, .3, .6, .7], picker=-1) 

772 mouse_event = SimpleNamespace(x=400, y=300) 

773 assert hb.contains(mouse_event)[0] 

774 

775 

776@image_comparison(['hexbin_log.png'], style='mpl20') 

777def test_hexbin_log(): 

778 # Issue #1636 (and also test log scaled colorbar) 

779 

780 # Remove this line when this test image is regenerated. 

781 plt.rcParams['pcolormesh.snap'] = False 

782 

783 np.random.seed(19680801) 

784 n = 100000 

785 x = np.random.standard_normal(n) 

786 y = 2.0 + 3.0 * x + 4.0 * np.random.standard_normal(n) 

787 y = np.power(2, y * 0.5) 

788 

789 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

790 h = ax.hexbin(x, y, yscale='log', bins='log') 

791 plt.colorbar(h) 

792 

793 

794def test_inverted_limits(): 

795 # Test gh:1553 

796 # Calling invert_xaxis prior to plotting should not disable autoscaling 

797 # while still maintaining the inverted direction 

798 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

799 ax.invert_xaxis() 

800 ax.plot([-5, -3, 2, 4], [1, 2, -3, 5]) 

801 

802 assert ax.get_xlim() == (4, -5) 

803 assert ax.get_ylim() == (-3, 5) 

804 plt.close() 

805 

806 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

807 ax.invert_yaxis() 

808 ax.plot([-5, -3, 2, 4], [1, 2, -3, 5]) 

809 

810 assert ax.get_xlim() == (-5, 4) 

811 assert ax.get_ylim() == (5, -3) 

812 

813 # Test inverting nonlinear axes. 

814 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

815 ax.set_yscale("log") 

816 ax.set_ylim(10, 1) 

817 assert ax.get_ylim() == (10, 1) 

818 

819 

820@image_comparison(['nonfinite_limits']) 

821def test_nonfinite_limits(): 

822 x = np.arange(0., np.e, 0.01) 

823 # silence divide by zero warning from log(0) 

824 with np.errstate(divide='ignore'): 

825 y = np.log(x) 

826 x[len(x)//2] = np.nan 

827 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

828 ax.plot(x, y) 

829 

830 

831@pytest.mark.style('default') 

832@pytest.mark.parametrize('plot_fun', 

833 ['scatter', 'plot', 'fill_between']) 

834@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

835def test_limits_empty_data(plot_fun, fig_test, fig_ref): 

836 # Check that plotting empty data doesn't change autoscaling of dates 

837 x = np.arange("2010-01-01", "2011-01-01", dtype="datetime64[D]") 

838 

839 ax_test = fig_test.subplots() 

840 ax_ref = fig_ref.subplots() 

841 

842 getattr(ax_test, plot_fun)([], []) 

843 

844 for ax in [ax_test, ax_ref]: 

845 getattr(ax, plot_fun)(x, range(len(x)), color='C0') 

846 

847 

848@image_comparison(['imshow', 'imshow'], remove_text=True, style='mpl20') 

849def test_imshow(): 

850 # use former defaults to match existing baseline image 

851 matplotlib.rcParams['image.interpolation'] = 'nearest' 

852 # Create a NxN image 

853 N = 100 

854 (x, y) = np.indices((N, N)) 

855 x -= N//2 

856 y -= N//2 

857 r = np.sqrt(x**2+y**2-x*y) 

858 

859 # Create a contour plot at N/4 and extract both the clip path and transform 

860 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

861 ax.imshow(r) 

862 

863 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

864 data = {"r": r} 

865 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

866 ax.imshow("r", data=data) 

867 

868 

869@image_comparison(['imshow_clip'], style='mpl20') 

870def test_imshow_clip(): 

871 # As originally reported by Gellule Xg <gellule.xg@free.fr> 

872 # use former defaults to match existing baseline image 

873 matplotlib.rcParams['image.interpolation'] = 'nearest' 

874 

875 # Create a NxN image 

876 N = 100 

877 (x, y) = np.indices((N, N)) 

878 x -= N//2 

879 y -= N//2 

880 r = np.sqrt(x**2+y**2-x*y) 

881 

882 # Create a contour plot at N/4 and extract both the clip path and transform 

883 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

884 

885 c = ax.contour(r, [N/4]) 

886 x = c.collections[0] 

887 clip_path = x.get_paths()[0] 

888 clip_transform = x.get_transform() 

889 

890 clip_path = mtransforms.TransformedPath(clip_path, clip_transform) 

891 

892 # Plot the image clipped by the contour 

893 ax.imshow(r, clip_path=clip_path) 

894 

895 

896@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

897def test_imshow_norm_vminvmax(fig_test, fig_ref): 

898 """Parameters vmin, vmax should be ignored if norm is given.""" 

899 a = [[1, 2], [3, 4]] 

900 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

901 ax.imshow(a, vmin=0, vmax=5) 

902 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

903 with pytest.warns(MatplotlibDeprecationWarning, 

904 match="Passing parameters norm and vmin/vmax " 

905 "simultaneously is deprecated."): 

906 ax.imshow(a, norm=mcolors.Normalize(-10, 10), vmin=0, vmax=5) 

907 

908 

909@image_comparison(['polycollection_joinstyle'], remove_text=True) 

910def test_polycollection_joinstyle(): 

911 # Bug #2890979 reported by Matthew West 

912 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

913 verts = np.array([[1, 1], [1, 2], [2, 2], [2, 1]]) 

914 c = mpl.collections.PolyCollection([verts], linewidths=40) 

915 ax.add_collection(c) 

916 ax.set_xbound(0, 3) 

917 ax.set_ybound(0, 3) 

918 

919 

920@pytest.mark.parametrize( 

921 'x, y1, y2', [ 

922 (np.zeros((2, 2)), 3, 3), 

923 (np.arange(0.0, 2, 0.02), np.zeros((2, 2)), 3), 

924 (np.arange(0.0, 2, 0.02), 3, np.zeros((2, 2))) 

925 ], ids=[ 

926 '2d_x_input', 

927 '2d_y1_input', 

928 '2d_y2_input' 

929 ] 

930) 

931def test_fill_between_input(x, y1, y2): 

932 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

933 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

934 ax.fill_between(x, y1, y2) 

935 

936 

937@pytest.mark.parametrize( 

938 'y, x1, x2', [ 

939 (np.zeros((2, 2)), 3, 3), 

940 (np.arange(0.0, 2, 0.02), np.zeros((2, 2)), 3), 

941 (np.arange(0.0, 2, 0.02), 3, np.zeros((2, 2))) 

942 ], ids=[ 

943 '2d_y_input', 

944 '2d_x1_input', 

945 '2d_x2_input' 

946 ] 

947) 

948def test_fill_betweenx_input(y, x1, x2): 

949 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

950 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

951 ax.fill_betweenx(y, x1, x2) 

952 

953 

954@image_comparison(['fill_between_interpolate'], remove_text=True) 

955def test_fill_between_interpolate(): 

956 x = np.arange(0.0, 2, 0.02) 

957 y1 = np.sin(2*np.pi*x) 

958 y2 = 1.2*np.sin(4*np.pi*x) 

959 

960 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(2, 1, sharex=True) 

961 ax1.plot(x, y1, x, y2, color='black') 

962 ax1.fill_between(x, y1, y2, where=y2 >= y1, facecolor='white', hatch='/', 

963 interpolate=True) 

964 ax1.fill_between(x, y1, y2, where=y2 <= y1, facecolor='red', 

965 interpolate=True) 

966 

967 # Test support for masked arrays. 

968 y2 = np.ma.masked_greater(y2, 1.0) 

969 # Test that plotting works for masked arrays with the first element masked 

970 y2[0] = np.ma.masked 

971 ax2.plot(x, y1, x, y2, color='black') 

972 ax2.fill_between(x, y1, y2, where=y2 >= y1, facecolor='green', 

973 interpolate=True) 

974 ax2.fill_between(x, y1, y2, where=y2 <= y1, facecolor='red', 

975 interpolate=True) 

976 

977 

978@image_comparison(['fill_between_interpolate_decreasing'], 

979 style='mpl20', remove_text=True) 

980def test_fill_between_interpolate_decreasing(): 

981 p = np.array([724.3, 700, 655]) 

982 t = np.array([9.4, 7, 2.2]) 

983 prof = np.array([7.9, 6.6, 3.8]) 

984 

985 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(9, 9)) 

986 

987 ax.plot(t, p, 'tab:red') 

988 ax.plot(prof, p, 'k') 

989 

990 ax.fill_betweenx(p, t, prof, where=prof < t, 

991 facecolor='blue', interpolate=True, alpha=0.4) 

992 ax.fill_betweenx(p, t, prof, where=prof > t, 

993 facecolor='red', interpolate=True, alpha=0.4) 

994 

995 ax.set_xlim(0, 30) 

996 ax.set_ylim(800, 600) 

997 

998 

999# test_symlog and test_symlog2 used to have baseline images in all three 

1000# formats, but the png and svg baselines got invalidated by the removal of 

1001# minor tick overstriking. 

1002@image_comparison(['symlog.pdf']) 

1003def test_symlog(): 

1004 x = np.array([0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 9, 12, 24]) 

1005 y = np.array([1000000, 500000, 100000, 100, 5, 0, 0, 0]) 

1006 

1007 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1008 ax.plot(x, y) 

1009 ax.set_yscale('symlog') 

1010 ax.set_xscale('linear') 

1011 ax.set_ylim(-1, 10000000) 

1012 

1013 

1014@image_comparison(['symlog2.pdf'], remove_text=True) 

1015def test_symlog2(): 

1016 # Numbers from -50 to 50, with 0.1 as step 

1017 x = np.arange(-50, 50, 0.001) 

1018 

1019 fig, axs = plt.subplots(5, 1) 

1020 for ax, linthresh in zip(axs, [20., 2., 1., 0.1, 0.01]): 

1021 ax.plot(x, x) 

1022 ax.set_xscale('symlog', linthresh=linthresh) 

1023 ax.grid(True) 

1024 axs[-1].set_ylim(-0.1, 0.1) 

1025 

1026 

1027def test_pcolorargs_5205(): 

1028 # Smoketest to catch issue found in gh:5205 

1029 x = [-1.5, -1.0, -0.5, 0.0, 0.5, 1.0, 1.5] 

1030 y = [-1.5, -1.25, -1.0, -0.75, -0.5, -0.25, 0, 

1031 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1.0, 1.25, 1.5] 

1032 X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y) 

1033 Z = np.hypot(X, Y) 

1034 

1035 plt.pcolor(Z) 

1036 plt.pcolor(list(Z)) 

1037 plt.pcolor(x, y, Z[:-1, :-1]) 

1038 plt.pcolor(X, Y, list(Z[:-1, :-1])) 

1039 

1040 

1041@image_comparison(['pcolormesh'], remove_text=True) 

1042def test_pcolormesh(): 

1043 # Remove this line when this test image is regenerated. 

1044 plt.rcParams['pcolormesh.snap'] = False 

1045 

1046 n = 12 

1047 x = np.linspace(-1.5, 1.5, n) 

1048 y = np.linspace(-1.5, 1.5, n*2) 

1049 X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y) 

1050 Qx = np.cos(Y) - np.cos(X) 

1051 Qz = np.sin(Y) + np.sin(X) 

1052 Qx = (Qx + 1.1) 

1053 Z = np.hypot(X, Y) / 5 

1054 Z = (Z - Z.min()) / Z.ptp() 

1055 

1056 # The color array can include masked values: 

1057 Zm = ma.masked_where(np.abs(Qz) < 0.5 * np.max(Qz), Z) 

1058 

1059 fig, (ax1, ax2, ax3) = plt.subplots(1, 3) 

1060 ax1.pcolormesh(Qx, Qz, Z[:-1, :-1], lw=0.5, edgecolors='k') 

1061 ax2.pcolormesh(Qx, Qz, Z[:-1, :-1], lw=2, edgecolors=['b', 'w']) 

1062 ax3.pcolormesh(Qx, Qz, Z, shading="gouraud") 

1063 

1064 

1065@image_comparison(['pcolormesh_alpha'], extensions=["png", "pdf"], 

1066 remove_text=True) 

1067def test_pcolormesh_alpha(): 

1068 # Remove this line when this test image is regenerated. 

1069 plt.rcParams['pcolormesh.snap'] = False 

1070 

1071 n = 12 

1072 X, Y = np.meshgrid( 

1073 np.linspace(-1.5, 1.5, n), 

1074 np.linspace(-1.5, 1.5, n*2) 

1075 ) 

1076 Qx = X 

1077 Qy = Y + np.sin(X) 

1078 Z = np.hypot(X, Y) / 5 

1079 Z = (Z - Z.min()) / Z.ptp() 

1080 vir = plt.get_cmap("viridis", 16) 

1081 # make another colormap with varying alpha 

1082 colors = vir(np.arange(16)) 

1083 colors[:, 3] = 0.5 + 0.5*np.sin(np.arange(16)) 

1084 cmap = mcolors.ListedColormap(colors) 

1085 

1086 fig, ((ax1, ax2), (ax3, ax4)) = plt.subplots(2, 2) 

1087 for ax in ax1, ax2, ax3, ax4: 

1088 ax.add_patch(mpatches.Rectangle( 

1089 (0, -1.5), 1.5, 3, facecolor=[.7, .1, .1, .5], zorder=0 

1090 )) 

1091 # ax1, ax2: constant alpha 

1092 ax1.pcolormesh(Qx, Qy, Z[:-1, :-1], cmap=vir, alpha=0.4, 

1093 shading='flat', zorder=1) 

1094 ax2.pcolormesh(Qx, Qy, Z, cmap=vir, alpha=0.4, shading='gouraud', zorder=1) 

1095 # ax3, ax4: alpha from colormap 

1096 ax3.pcolormesh(Qx, Qy, Z[:-1, :-1], cmap=cmap, shading='flat', zorder=1) 

1097 ax4.pcolormesh(Qx, Qy, Z, cmap=cmap, shading='gouraud', zorder=1) 

1098 

1099 

1100@image_comparison(['pcolormesh_datetime_axis.png'], 

1101 remove_text=False, style='mpl20') 

1102def test_pcolormesh_datetime_axis(): 

1103 # Remove this line when this test image is regenerated. 

1104 plt.rcParams['pcolormesh.snap'] = False 

1105 

1106 fig = plt.figure() 

1107 fig.subplots_adjust(hspace=0.4, top=0.98, bottom=.15) 

1108 base = datetime.datetime(2013, 1, 1) 

1109 x = np.array([base + datetime.timedelta(days=d) for d in range(21)]) 

1110 y = np.arange(21) 

1111 z1, z2 = np.meshgrid(np.arange(20), np.arange(20)) 

1112 z = z1 * z2 

1113 plt.subplot(221) 

1114 plt.pcolormesh(x[:-1], y[:-1], z[:-1, :-1]) 

1115 plt.subplot(222) 

1116 plt.pcolormesh(x, y, z) 

1117 x = np.repeat(x[np.newaxis], 21, axis=0) 

1118 y = np.repeat(y[:, np.newaxis], 21, axis=1) 

1119 plt.subplot(223) 

1120 plt.pcolormesh(x[:-1, :-1], y[:-1, :-1], z[:-1, :-1]) 

1121 plt.subplot(224) 

1122 plt.pcolormesh(x, y, z) 

1123 for ax in fig.get_axes(): 

1124 for label in ax.get_xticklabels(): 

1125 label.set_ha('right') 

1126 label.set_rotation(30) 

1127 

1128 

1129@image_comparison(['pcolor_datetime_axis.png'], 

1130 remove_text=False, style='mpl20') 

1131def test_pcolor_datetime_axis(): 

1132 fig = plt.figure() 

1133 fig.subplots_adjust(hspace=0.4, top=0.98, bottom=.15) 

1134 base = datetime.datetime(2013, 1, 1) 

1135 x = np.array([base + datetime.timedelta(days=d) for d in range(21)]) 

1136 y = np.arange(21) 

1137 z1, z2 = np.meshgrid(np.arange(20), np.arange(20)) 

1138 z = z1 * z2 

1139 plt.subplot(221) 

1140 plt.pcolor(x[:-1], y[:-1], z[:-1, :-1]) 

1141 plt.subplot(222) 

1142 plt.pcolor(x, y, z) 

1143 x = np.repeat(x[np.newaxis], 21, axis=0) 

1144 y = np.repeat(y[:, np.newaxis], 21, axis=1) 

1145 plt.subplot(223) 

1146 plt.pcolor(x[:-1, :-1], y[:-1, :-1], z[:-1, :-1]) 

1147 plt.subplot(224) 

1148 plt.pcolor(x, y, z) 

1149 for ax in fig.get_axes(): 

1150 for label in ax.get_xticklabels(): 

1151 label.set_ha('right') 

1152 label.set_rotation(30) 

1153 

1154 

1155def test_pcolorargs(): 

1156 n = 12 

1157 x = np.linspace(-1.5, 1.5, n) 

1158 y = np.linspace(-1.5, 1.5, n*2) 

1159 X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y) 

1160 Z = np.hypot(X, Y) / 5 

1161 

1162 _, ax = plt.subplots() 

1163 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

1164 ax.pcolormesh(y, x, Z) 

1165 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

1166 ax.pcolormesh(X, Y, Z.T) 

1167 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

1168 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, Z[:-1, :-1], shading="gouraud") 

1169 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

1170 ax.pcolormesh(X, Y, Z[:-1, :-1], shading="gouraud") 

1171 x[0] = np.NaN 

1172 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

1173 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, Z[:-1, :-1]) 

1174 with np.errstate(invalid='ignore'): 

1175 x = np.ma.array(x, mask=(x < 0)) 

1176 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

1177 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, Z[:-1, :-1]) 

1178 # Expect a warning with non-increasing coordinates 

1179 x = [359, 0, 1] 

1180 y = [-10, 10] 

1181 X, Y = np.meshgrid(x, y) 

1182 Z = np.zeros(X.shape) 

1183 with pytest.warns(UserWarning, 

1184 match='are not monotonically increasing or decreasing'): 

1185 ax.pcolormesh(X, Y, Z, shading='auto') 

1186 

1187 

1188@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

1189def test_pcolornearest(fig_test, fig_ref): 

1190 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

1191 x = np.arange(0, 10) 

1192 y = np.arange(0, 3) 

1193 np.random.seed(19680801) 

1194 Z = np.random.randn(2, 9) 

1195 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, Z, shading='flat') 

1196 

1197 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

1198 # specify the centers 

1199 x2 = x[:-1] + np.diff(x) / 2 

1200 y2 = y[:-1] + np.diff(y) / 2 

1201 ax.pcolormesh(x2, y2, Z, shading='nearest') 

1202 

1203 

1204@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

1205def test_pcolornearestunits(fig_test, fig_ref): 

1206 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

1207 x = [datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp(x * 3600) for x in range(10)] 

1208 y = np.arange(0, 3) 

1209 np.random.seed(19680801) 

1210 Z = np.random.randn(2, 9) 

1211 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, Z, shading='flat') 

1212 

1213 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

1214 # specify the centers 

1215 x2 = [datetime.datetime.fromtimestamp((x + 0.5) * 3600) for x in range(9)] 

1216 y2 = y[:-1] + np.diff(y) / 2 

1217 ax.pcolormesh(x2, y2, Z, shading='nearest') 

1218 

1219 

1220@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

1221def test_pcolordropdata(fig_test, fig_ref): 

1222 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

1223 x = np.arange(0, 10) 

1224 y = np.arange(0, 4) 

1225 np.random.seed(19680801) 

1226 Z = np.random.randn(3, 9) 

1227 # fake dropping the data 

1228 ax.pcolormesh(x[:-1], y[:-1], Z[:-1, :-1], shading='flat') 

1229 

1230 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

1231 # test dropping the data... 

1232 x2 = x[:-1] 

1233 y2 = y[:-1] 

1234 with pytest.warns(MatplotlibDeprecationWarning): 

1235 ax.pcolormesh(x2, y2, Z, shading='flat') 

1236 

1237 

1238@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

1239def test_pcolorauto(fig_test, fig_ref): 

1240 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

1241 x = np.arange(0, 10) 

1242 y = np.arange(0, 4) 

1243 np.random.seed(19680801) 

1244 Z = np.random.randn(3, 9) 

1245 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, Z, shading='auto') 

1246 

1247 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

1248 # specify the centers 

1249 x2 = x[:-1] + np.diff(x) / 2 

1250 y2 = y[:-1] + np.diff(y) / 2 

1251 ax.pcolormesh(x2, y2, Z, shading='auto') 

1252

1254@image_comparison(['canonical']) 

1255def test_canonical(): 

1256 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1257 ax.plot([1, 2, 3]) 

1258 

1259 

1260@image_comparison(['arc_angles.png'], remove_text=True, style='default') 

1261def test_arc_angles(): 

1262 # Ellipse parameters 

1263 w = 2 

1264 h = 1 

1265 centre = (0.2, 0.5) 

1266 scale = 2 

1267 

1268 fig, axs = plt.subplots(3, 3) 

1269 for i, ax in enumerate(axs.flat): 

1270 theta2 = i * 360 / 9 

1271 theta1 = theta2 - 45 

1272 

1273 ax.add_patch(mpatches.Ellipse(centre, w, h, alpha=0.3)) 

1274 ax.add_patch(mpatches.Arc(centre, w, h, theta1=theta1, theta2=theta2)) 

1275 # Straight lines intersecting start and end of arc 

1276 ax.plot([scale * np.cos(np.deg2rad(theta1)) + centre[0], 

1277 centre[0], 

1278 scale * np.cos(np.deg2rad(theta2)) + centre[0]], 

1279 [scale * np.sin(np.deg2rad(theta1)) + centre[1], 

1280 centre[1], 

1281 scale * np.sin(np.deg2rad(theta2)) + centre[1]]) 

1282 

1283 ax.set_xlim(-scale, scale) 

1284 ax.set_ylim(-scale, scale) 

1285 

1286 # This looks the same, but it triggers a different code path when it 

1287 # gets large enough. 

1288 w *= 10 

1289 h *= 10 

1290 centre = (centre[0] * 10, centre[1] * 10) 

1291 scale *= 10 

1292 

1293 

1294@image_comparison(['arc_ellipse'], remove_text=True) 

1295def test_arc_ellipse(): 

1296 xcenter, ycenter = 0.38, 0.52 

1297 width, height = 1e-1, 3e-1 

1298 angle = -30 

1299 

1300 theta = np.deg2rad(np.arange(360)) 

1301 x = width / 2. * np.cos(theta) 

1302 y = height / 2. * np.sin(theta) 

1303 

1304 rtheta = np.deg2rad(angle) 

1305 R = np.array([ 

1306 [np.cos(rtheta), -np.sin(rtheta)], 

1307 [np.sin(rtheta), np.cos(rtheta)]]) 

1308 

1309 x, y = np.dot(R, np.array([x, y])) 

1310 x += xcenter 

1311 y += ycenter 

1312 

1313 fig = plt.figure() 

1314 ax = fig.add_subplot(211, aspect='auto') 

1315 ax.fill(x, y, alpha=0.2, facecolor='yellow', edgecolor='yellow', 

1316 linewidth=1, zorder=1) 

1317 

1318 e1 = mpatches.Arc((xcenter, ycenter), width, height, 

1319 angle=angle, linewidth=2, fill=False, zorder=2) 

1320 

1321 ax.add_patch(e1) 

1322 

1323 ax = fig.add_subplot(212, aspect='equal') 

1324 ax.fill(x, y, alpha=0.2, facecolor='green', edgecolor='green', zorder=1) 

1325 e2 = mpatches.Arc((xcenter, ycenter), width, height, 

1326 angle=angle, linewidth=2, fill=False, zorder=2) 

1327 

1328 ax.add_patch(e2) 

1329 

1330 

1331def test_marker_as_markerstyle(): 

1332 fix, ax = plt.subplots() 

1333 m = mmarkers.MarkerStyle('o') 

1334 ax.plot([1, 2, 3], [3, 2, 1], marker=m) 

1335 ax.scatter([1, 2, 3], [4, 3, 2], marker=m) 

1336 ax.errorbar([1, 2, 3], [5, 4, 3], marker=m) 

1337 

1338 

1339@image_comparison(['markevery'], remove_text=True) 

1340def test_markevery(): 

1341 x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100) 

1342 y = np.sin(x) * np.sqrt(x/10 + 0.5) 

1343 

1344 # check marker only plot 

1345 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1346 ax.plot(x, y, 'o', label='default') 

1347 ax.plot(x, y, 'd', markevery=None, label='mark all') 

1348 ax.plot(x, y, 's', markevery=10, label='mark every 10') 

1349 ax.plot(x, y, '+', markevery=(5, 20), label='mark every 5 starting at 10') 

1350 ax.legend() 

1351 

1352 

1353@image_comparison(['markevery_line'], remove_text=True) 

1354def test_markevery_line(): 

1355 x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100) 

1356 y = np.sin(x) * np.sqrt(x/10 + 0.5) 

1357 

1358 # check line/marker combos 

1359 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1360 ax.plot(x, y, '-o', label='default') 

1361 ax.plot(x, y, '-d', markevery=None, label='mark all') 

1362 ax.plot(x, y, '-s', markevery=10, label='mark every 10') 

1363 ax.plot(x, y, '-+', markevery=(5, 20), label='mark every 5 starting at 10') 

1364 ax.legend() 

1365 

1366 

1367@image_comparison(['markevery_linear_scales'], remove_text=True) 

1368def test_markevery_linear_scales(): 

1369 cases = [None, 

1370 8, 

1371 (30, 8), 

1372 [16, 24, 30], [0, -1], 

1373 slice(100, 200, 3), 

1374 0.1, 0.3, 1.5, 

1375 (0.0, 0.1), (0.45, 0.1)] 

1376 

1377 cols = 3 

1378 gs = matplotlib.gridspec.GridSpec(len(cases) // cols + 1, cols) 

1379 

1380 delta = 0.11 

1381 x = np.linspace(0, 10 - 2 * delta, 200) + delta 

1382 y = np.sin(x) + 1.0 + delta 

1383 

1384 for i, case in enumerate(cases): 

1385 row = (i // cols) 

1386 col = i % cols 

1387 plt.subplot(gs[row, col]) 

1388 plt.title('markevery=%s' % str(case)) 

1389 plt.plot(x, y, 'o', ls='-', ms=4, markevery=case) 

1390 

1391 

1392@image_comparison(['markevery_linear_scales_zoomed'], remove_text=True) 

1393def test_markevery_linear_scales_zoomed(): 

1394 cases = [None, 

1395 8, 

1396 (30, 8), 

1397 [16, 24, 30], [0, -1], 

1398 slice(100, 200, 3), 

1399 0.1, 0.3, 1.5, 

1400 (0.0, 0.1), (0.45, 0.1)] 

1401 

1402 cols = 3 

1403 gs = matplotlib.gridspec.GridSpec(len(cases) // cols + 1, cols) 

1404 

1405 delta = 0.11 

1406 x = np.linspace(0, 10 - 2 * delta, 200) + delta 

1407 y = np.sin(x) + 1.0 + delta 

1408 

1409 for i, case in enumerate(cases): 

1410 row = (i // cols) 

1411 col = i % cols 

1412 plt.subplot(gs[row, col]) 

1413 plt.title('markevery=%s' % str(case)) 

1414 plt.plot(x, y, 'o', ls='-', ms=4, markevery=case) 

1415 plt.xlim((6, 6.7)) 

1416 plt.ylim((1.1, 1.7)) 

1417 

1418 

1419@image_comparison(['markevery_log_scales'], remove_text=True) 

1420def test_markevery_log_scales(): 

1421 cases = [None, 

1422 8, 

1423 (30, 8), 

1424 [16, 24, 30], [0, -1], 

1425 slice(100, 200, 3), 

1426 0.1, 0.3, 1.5, 

1427 (0.0, 0.1), (0.45, 0.1)] 

1428 

1429 cols = 3 

1430 gs = matplotlib.gridspec.GridSpec(len(cases) // cols + 1, cols) 

1431 

1432 delta = 0.11 

1433 x = np.linspace(0, 10 - 2 * delta, 200) + delta 

1434 y = np.sin(x) + 1.0 + delta 

1435 

1436 for i, case in enumerate(cases): 

1437 row = (i // cols) 

1438 col = i % cols 

1439 plt.subplot(gs[row, col]) 

1440 plt.title('markevery=%s' % str(case)) 

1441 plt.xscale('log') 

1442 plt.yscale('log') 

1443 plt.plot(x, y, 'o', ls='-', ms=4, markevery=case) 

1444 

1445 

1446@image_comparison(['markevery_polar'], style='default', remove_text=True) 

1447def test_markevery_polar(): 

1448 cases = [None, 

1449 8, 

1450 (30, 8), 

1451 [16, 24, 30], [0, -1], 

1452 slice(100, 200, 3), 

1453 0.1, 0.3, 1.5, 

1454 (0.0, 0.1), (0.45, 0.1)] 

1455 

1456 cols = 3 

1457 gs = matplotlib.gridspec.GridSpec(len(cases) // cols + 1, cols) 

1458 

1459 r = np.linspace(0, 3.0, 200) 

1460 theta = 2 * np.pi * r 

1461 

1462 for i, case in enumerate(cases): 

1463 row = (i // cols) 

1464 col = i % cols 

1465 plt.subplot(gs[row, col], polar=True) 

1466 plt.title('markevery=%s' % str(case)) 

1467 plt.plot(theta, r, 'o', ls='-', ms=4, markevery=case) 

1468 

1469 

1470@image_comparison(['marker_edges'], remove_text=True) 

1471def test_marker_edges(): 

1472 x = np.linspace(0, 1, 10) 

1473 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1474 ax.plot(x, np.sin(x), 'y.', ms=30.0, mew=0, mec='r') 

1475 ax.plot(x+0.1, np.sin(x), 'y.', ms=30.0, mew=1, mec='r') 

1476 ax.plot(x+0.2, np.sin(x), 'y.', ms=30.0, mew=2, mec='b') 

1477

1479@image_comparison(['bar_tick_label_single.png', 'bar_tick_label_single.png']) 

1480def test_bar_tick_label_single(): 

1481 # From 2516: plot bar with array of string labels for x axis 

1482 ax = plt.gca() 

1483 ax.bar(0, 1, align='edge', tick_label='0') 

1484 

1485 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

1486 data = {"a": 0, "b": 1} 

1487 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1488 ax = plt.gca() 

1489 ax.bar("a", "b", align='edge', tick_label='0', data=data) 

1490

1492def test_nan_bar_values(): 

1493 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1494 ax.bar([0, 1], [np.nan, 4]) 

1495 

1496 

1497def test_bar_ticklabel_fail(): 

1498 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

1499 ax.bar([], [])

1503def test_bar_tick_label_multiple():

1505 ax = plt.gca() 

1506 ax.bar([1, 2.5], [1, 2], width=[0.2, 0.5], tick_label=['a', 'b'], 

1507 align='center')

1510@image_comparison(['bar_tick_label_multiple_old_label_alignment.png']) 

1511def test_bar_tick_label_multiple_old_alignment(): 

1512 # Test that the alignment for class is backward compatible 

1513 matplotlib.rcParams["ytick.alignment"] = "center" 

1514 ax = plt.gca() 

1515 ax.bar([1, 2.5], [1, 2], width=[0.2, 0.5], tick_label=['a', 'b'], 

1516 align='center')
