3766@image_comparison(['hist_stacked_bar']) 

3767def test_hist_stacked_bar(): 

3768 # make some data 

3769 d = [[100, 100, 100, 100, 200, 320, 450, 80, 20, 600, 310, 800], 

3770 [20, 23, 50, 11, 100, 420], [120, 120, 120, 140, 140, 150, 180], 

3771 [60, 60, 60, 60, 300, 300, 5, 5, 5, 5, 10, 300], 

3772 [555, 555, 555, 30, 30, 30, 30, 30, 100, 100, 100, 100, 30, 30], 

3773 [30, 30, 30, 30, 400, 400, 400, 400, 400, 400, 400, 400]] 

3774 colors = [(0.5759849696758961, 1.0, 0.0), (0.0, 1.0, 0.350624650815206), 

3775 (0.0, 1.0, 0.6549834156005998), (0.0, 0.6569064625276622, 1.0), 

3776 (0.28302699607823545, 0.0, 1.0), (0.6849123462299822, 0.0, 1.0)] 

3777 labels = ['green', 'orange', ' yellow', 'magenta', 'black'] 

3778 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

3779 ax.hist(d, bins=10, histtype='barstacked', align='mid', color=colors, 

3780 label=labels) 

3781 ax.legend(loc='upper right', bbox_to_anchor=(1.0, 1.0), ncol=1) 

3782 

3783 

3784def test_hist_barstacked_bottom_unchanged(): 

3785 b = np.array([10, 20]) 

3786 plt.hist([[0, 1], [0, 1]], 2, histtype="barstacked", bottom=b) 

3787 assert b.tolist() == [10, 20] 

3788 

3789 

3790def test_hist_emptydata(): 

3791 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

3792 ax.hist([[], range(10), range(10)], histtype="step") 

3793 

3794 

3795def test_hist_labels(): 

3796 # test singleton labels OK 

3797 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

3798 _, _, bars = ax.hist([0, 1], label=0) 

3799 assert bars[0].get_label() == '0' 

3800 _, _, bars = ax.hist([0, 1], label=[0]) 

3801 assert bars[0].get_label() == '0' 

3802 _, _, bars = ax.hist([0, 1], label=None) 

3803 assert bars[0].get_label() == '_nolegend_' 

3804 _, _, bars = ax.hist([0, 1], label='0') 

3805 assert bars[0].get_label() == '0' 

3806 _, _, bars = ax.hist([0, 1], label='00') 

3807 assert bars[0].get_label() == '00' 

3808 

3809 

3810@image_comparison(['transparent_markers'], remove_text=True) 

3811def test_transparent_markers(): 

3812 np.random.seed(0) 

3813 data = np.random.random(50) 

3814 

3815 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

3816 ax.plot(data, 'D', mfc='none', markersize=100) 

3817 

3818 

3819@image_comparison(['rgba_markers'], remove_text=True) 

3820def test_rgba_markers(): 

3821 fig, axs = plt.subplots(ncols=2) 

3822 rcolors = [(1, 0, 0, 1), (1, 0, 0, 0.5)] 

3823 bcolors = [(0, 0, 1, 1), (0, 0, 1, 0.5)] 

3824 alphas = [None, 0.2] 

3825 kw = dict(ms=100, mew=20) 

3826 for i, alpha in enumerate(alphas): 

3827 for j, rcolor in enumerate(rcolors): 

3828 for k, bcolor in enumerate(bcolors): 

3829 axs[i].plot(j+1, k+1, 'o', mfc=bcolor, mec=rcolor, 

3830 alpha=alpha, **kw) 

3831 axs[i].plot(j+1, k+3, 'x', mec=rcolor, alpha=alpha, **kw) 

3832 for ax in axs: 

3833 ax.axis([-1, 4, 0, 5]) 

3834 

3835 

3836@image_comparison(['mollweide_grid'], remove_text=True) 

3837def test_mollweide_grid(): 

3838 # test that both horizontal and vertical gridlines appear on the Mollweide 

3839 # projection 

3840 fig = plt.figure() 

3841 ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='mollweide') 

3842 ax.grid() 

3843 

3844 

3845def test_mollweide_forward_inverse_closure(): 

3846 # test that the round-trip Mollweide forward->inverse transformation is an 

3847 # approximate identity 

3848 fig = plt.figure() 

3849 ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='mollweide') 

3850 

3851 # set up 1-degree grid in longitude, latitude 

3852 lon = np.linspace(-np.pi, np.pi, 360) 

3853 lat = np.linspace(-np.pi / 2.0, np.pi / 2.0, 180) 

3854 lon, lat = np.meshgrid(lon, lat) 

3855 ll = np.vstack((lon.flatten(), lat.flatten())).T 

3856 

3857 # perform forward transform 

3858 xy = ax.transProjection.transform(ll) 

3859 

3860 # perform inverse transform 

3861 ll2 = ax.transProjection.inverted().transform(xy) 

3862 

3863 # compare 

3864 np.testing.assert_array_almost_equal(ll, ll2, 3) 

3865 

3866 

3867def test_mollweide_inverse_forward_closure(): 

3868 # test that the round-trip Mollweide inverse->forward transformation is an 

3869 # approximate identity 

3870 fig = plt.figure() 

3871 ax = fig.add_subplot(projection='mollweide') 

3872 

3873 # set up grid in x, y 

3874 x = np.linspace(0, 1, 500) 

3875 x, y = np.meshgrid(x, x) 

3876 xy = np.vstack((x.flatten(), y.flatten())).T 

3877 

3878 # perform inverse transform 

3879 ll = ax.transProjection.inverted().transform(xy) 

3880 

3881 # perform forward transform 

3882 xy2 = ax.transProjection.transform(ll) 

3883 

3884 # compare 

3885 np.testing.assert_array_almost_equal(xy, xy2, 3) 

3886 

3887 

3888@image_comparison(['test_alpha'], remove_text=True) 

3889def test_alpha(): 

3890 np.random.seed(0) 

3891 data = np.random.random(50) 

3892 

3893 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

3894 

3895 # alpha=.5 markers, solid line 

3896 ax.plot(data, '-D', color=[1, 0, 0], mfc=[1, 0, 0, .5], 

3897 markersize=20, lw=10) 

3898 

3899 # everything solid by kwarg 

3900 ax.plot(data + 2, '-D', color=[1, 0, 0, .5], mfc=[1, 0, 0, .5], 

3901 markersize=20, lw=10, 

3902 alpha=1) 

3903 

3904 # everything alpha=.5 by kwarg 

3905 ax.plot(data + 4, '-D', color=[1, 0, 0], mfc=[1, 0, 0], 

3906 markersize=20, lw=10, 

3907 alpha=.5) 

3908 

3909 # everything alpha=.5 by colors 

3910 ax.plot(data + 6, '-D', color=[1, 0, 0, .5], mfc=[1, 0, 0, .5], 

3911 markersize=20, lw=10) 

3912 

3913 # alpha=.5 line, solid markers 

3914 ax.plot(data + 8, '-D', color=[1, 0, 0, .5], mfc=[1, 0, 0], 

3915 markersize=20, lw=10) 

3916 

3917 

3918@image_comparison(['eventplot', 'eventplot'], remove_text=True) 

3919def test_eventplot(): 

3920 np.random.seed(0) 

3921 

3922 data1 = np.random.random([32, 20]).tolist() 

3923 data2 = np.random.random([6, 20]).tolist() 

3924 data = data1 + data2 

3925 num_datasets = len(data) 

3926 

3927 colors1 = [[0, 1, .7]] * len(data1) 

3928 colors2 = [[1, 0, 0], 

3929 [0, 1, 0], 

3930 [0, 0, 1], 

3931 [1, .75, 0], 

3932 [1, 0, 1], 

3933 [0, 1, 1]] 

3934 colors = colors1 + colors2 

3935 

3936 lineoffsets1 = 12 + np.arange(0, len(data1)) * .33 

3937 lineoffsets2 = [-15, -3, 1, 1.5, 6, 10] 

3938 lineoffsets = lineoffsets1.tolist() + lineoffsets2 

3939 

3940 linelengths1 = [.33] * len(data1) 

3941 linelengths2 = [5, 2, 1, 1, 3, 1.5] 

3942 linelengths = linelengths1 + linelengths2 

3943 

3944 fig = plt.figure() 

3945 axobj = fig.add_subplot() 

3946 colls = axobj.eventplot(data, colors=colors, lineoffsets=lineoffsets, 

3947 linelengths=linelengths) 

3948 

3949 num_collections = len(colls) 

3950 assert num_collections == num_datasets 

3951 

3952 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

3953 data = {"pos": data, "c": colors, "lo": lineoffsets, "ll": linelengths} 

3954 fig = plt.figure() 

3955 axobj = fig.add_subplot() 

3956 colls = axobj.eventplot("pos", colors="c", lineoffsets="lo", 

3957 linelengths="ll", data=data) 

3958 num_collections = len(colls) 

3959 assert num_collections == num_datasets 

3960 

3961 

3962@image_comparison(['test_eventplot_defaults.png'], remove_text=True) 

3963def test_eventplot_defaults(): 

3964 """ 

3965 test that eventplot produces the correct output given the default params 

3966 (see bug #3728) 

3967 """ 

3968 np.random.seed(0) 

3969 

3970 data1 = np.random.random([32, 20]).tolist() 

3971 data2 = np.random.random([6, 20]).tolist() 

3972 data = data1 + data2 

3973 

3974 fig = plt.figure() 

3975 axobj = fig.add_subplot() 

3976 axobj.eventplot(data) 

3977 

3978 

3979@pytest.mark.parametrize(('colors'), [ 

3980 ('0.5',), # string color with multiple characters: not OK before #8193 fix 

3981 ('tab:orange', 'tab:pink', 'tab:cyan', 'bLacK'), # case-insensitive 

3982 ('red', (0, 1, 0), None, (1, 0, 1, 0.5)), # a tricky case mixing types 

3983]) 

3984def test_eventplot_colors(colors): 

3985 """Test the *colors* parameter of eventplot. Inspired by issue #8193.""" 

3986 data = [[0], [1], [2], [3]] # 4 successive events of different nature 

3987 

3988 # Build the list of the expected colors 

3989 expected = [c if c is not None else 'C0' for c in colors] 

3990 # Convert the list into an array of RGBA values 

3991 # NB: ['rgbk'] is not a valid argument for to_rgba_array, while 'rgbk' is. 

3992 if len(expected) == 1: 

3993 expected = expected[0] 

3994 expected = np.broadcast_to(mcolors.to_rgba_array(expected), (len(data), 4)) 

3995 

3996 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

3997 if len(colors) == 1: # tuple with a single string (like '0.5' or 'rgbk') 

3998 colors = colors[0] 

3999 collections = ax.eventplot(data, colors=colors) 

4000 

4001 for coll, color in zip(collections, expected): 

4002 assert_allclose(coll.get_color(), color) 

4003 

4004 

4005@image_comparison(['test_eventplot_problem_kwargs.png'], remove_text=True) 

4006def test_eventplot_problem_kwargs(recwarn): 

4007 """ 

4008 test that 'singular' versions of LineCollection props raise an 

4009 IgnoredKeywordWarning rather than overriding the 'plural' versions (e.g. 

4010 to prevent 'color' from overriding 'colors', see issue #4297) 

4011 """ 

4012 np.random.seed(0) 

4013 

4014 data1 = np.random.random([20]).tolist() 

4015 data2 = np.random.random([10]).tolist() 

4016 data = [data1, data2] 

4017 

4018 fig = plt.figure() 

4019 axobj = fig.add_subplot() 

4020 

4021 axobj.eventplot(data, 

4022 colors=['r', 'b'], 

4023 color=['c', 'm'], 

4024 linewidths=[2, 1], 

4025 linewidth=[1, 2], 

4026 linestyles=['solid', 'dashed'], 

4027 linestyle=['dashdot', 'dotted']) 

4028 

4029 # check that three IgnoredKeywordWarnings were raised 

4030 assert len(recwarn) == 3 

4031 assert all(issubclass(wi.category, MatplotlibDeprecationWarning) 

4032 for wi in recwarn) 

4033 

4034 

4035def test_empty_eventplot(): 

4036 fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

4037 ax.eventplot([[]], colors=[(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)]) 

4038 plt.draw() 

4039 

4040 

4041@pytest.mark.parametrize('data', [[[]], [[], [0, 1]], [[0, 1], []]]) 

4042@pytest.mark.parametrize( 

4043 'orientation', ['_empty', 'vertical', 'horizontal', None, 'none']) 

4044def test_eventplot_orientation(data, orientation): 

4045 """Introduced when fixing issue #6412.""" 

4046 opts = {} if orientation == "_empty" else {'orientation': orientation} 

4047 fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

4048 with (pytest.warns(MatplotlibDeprecationWarning) 

4049 if orientation in [None, 'none'] else nullcontext()): 

4050 ax.eventplot(data, **opts) 

4051 plt.draw() 

4052 

4053 

4054@image_comparison(['marker_styles.png'], remove_text=True) 

4055def test_marker_styles(): 

4056 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4057 for y, marker in enumerate(sorted(matplotlib.markers.MarkerStyle.markers, 

4058 key=lambda x: str(type(x))+str(x))): 

4059 ax.plot((y % 2)*5 + np.arange(10)*10, np.ones(10)*10*y, linestyle='', 

4060 marker=marker, markersize=10+y/5, label=marker) 

4061 

4062 

4063@image_comparison(['rc_markerfill.png']) 

4064def test_markers_fillstyle_rcparams(): 

4065 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4066 x = np.arange(7) 

4067 for idx, (style, marker) in enumerate( 

4068 [('top', 's'), ('bottom', 'o'), ('none', '^')]): 

4069 matplotlib.rcParams['markers.fillstyle'] = style 

4070 ax.plot(x+idx, marker=marker) 

4071 

4072 

4073@image_comparison(['vertex_markers.png'], remove_text=True) 

4074def test_vertex_markers(): 

4075 data = list(range(10)) 

4076 marker_as_tuple = ((-1, -1), (1, -1), (1, 1), (-1, 1)) 

4077 marker_as_list = [(-1, -1), (1, -1), (1, 1), (-1, 1)] 

4078 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4079 ax.plot(data, linestyle='', marker=marker_as_tuple, mfc='k') 

4080 ax.plot(data[::-1], linestyle='', marker=marker_as_list, mfc='b') 

4081 ax.set_xlim([-1, 10]) 

4082 ax.set_ylim([-1, 10]) 

4083 

4084 

4085@image_comparison(['vline_hline_zorder', 'errorbar_zorder'], 

4086 tol=0 if platform.machine() == 'x86_64' else 0.02) 

4087def test_eb_line_zorder(): 

4088 x = list(range(10)) 

4089 

4090 # First illustrate basic pyplot interface, using defaults where possible. 

4091 fig = plt.figure() 

4092 ax = fig.gca() 

4093 ax.plot(x, lw=10, zorder=5) 

4094 ax.axhline(1, color='red', lw=10, zorder=1) 

4095 ax.axhline(5, color='green', lw=10, zorder=10) 

4096 ax.axvline(7, color='m', lw=10, zorder=7) 

4097 ax.axvline(2, color='k', lw=10, zorder=3) 

4098 

4099 ax.set_title("axvline and axhline zorder test") 

4100 

4101 # Now switch to a more OO interface to exercise more features. 

4102 fig = plt.figure() 

4103 ax = fig.gca() 

4104 x = list(range(10)) 

4105 y = np.zeros(10) 

4106 yerr = list(range(10)) 

4107 ax.errorbar(x, y, yerr=yerr, zorder=5, lw=5, color='r') 

4108 for j in range(10): 

4109 ax.axhline(j, lw=5, color='k', zorder=j) 

4110 ax.axhline(-j, lw=5, color='k', zorder=j) 

4111 

4112 ax.set_title("errorbar zorder test") 

4113 

4114 

4115@check_figures_equal() 

4116def test_axline_loglog(fig_test, fig_ref): 

4117 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

4118 ax.set(xlim=(0.1, 10), ylim=(1e-3, 1)) 

4119 ax.loglog([.3, .6], [.3, .6], ".-") 

4120 ax.axline((1, 1e-3), (10, 1e-2), c="k") 

4121 

4122 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

4123 ax.set(xlim=(0.1, 10), ylim=(1e-3, 1)) 

4124 ax.loglog([.3, .6], [.3, .6], ".-") 

4125 ax.loglog([1, 10], [1e-3, 1e-2], c="k") 

4126 

4127 

4128@check_figures_equal() 

4129def test_axline(fig_test, fig_ref): 

4130 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

4131 ax.set(xlim=(-1, 1), ylim=(-1, 1)) 

4132 ax.axline((0, 0), (1, 1)) 

4133 ax.axline((0, 0), (1, 0), color='C1') 

4134 ax.axline((0, 0.5), (1, 0.5), color='C2') 

4135 # slopes 

4136 ax.axline((-0.7, -0.5), slope=0, color='C3') 

4137 ax.axline((1, -0.5), slope=-0.5, color='C4') 

4138 ax.axline((-0.5, 1), slope=float('inf'), color='C5') 

4139 

4140 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

4141 ax.set(xlim=(-1, 1), ylim=(-1, 1)) 

4142 ax.plot([-1, 1], [-1, 1]) 

4143 ax.axhline(0, color='C1') 

4144 ax.axhline(0.5, color='C2') 

4145 # slopes 

4146 ax.axhline(-0.5, color='C3') 

4147 ax.plot([-1, 1], [0.5, -0.5], color='C4') 

4148 ax.axvline(-0.5, color='C5') 

4149 

4150 

4151@check_figures_equal() 

4152def test_axline_transaxes(fig_test, fig_ref): 

4153 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

4154 ax.set(xlim=(-1, 1), ylim=(-1, 1)) 

4155 ax.axline((0, 0), slope=1, transform=ax.transAxes) 

4156 ax.axline((1, 0.5), slope=1, color='C1', transform=ax.transAxes) 

4157 ax.axline((0.5, 0.5), slope=0, color='C2', transform=ax.transAxes) 

4158 ax.axline((0.5, 0), (0.5, 1), color='C3', transform=ax.transAxes) 

4159 

4160 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

4161 ax.set(xlim=(-1, 1), ylim=(-1, 1)) 

4162 ax.plot([-1, 1], [-1, 1]) 

4163 ax.plot([0, 1], [-1, 0], color='C1') 

4164 ax.plot([-1, 1], [0, 0], color='C2') 

4165 ax.plot([0, 0], [-1, 1], color='C3') 

4166 

4167 

4168@check_figures_equal() 

4169def test_axline_transaxes_panzoom(fig_test, fig_ref): 

4170 # test that it is robust against pan/zoom and 

4171 # figure resize after plotting 

4172 ax = fig_test.subplots() 

4173 ax.set(xlim=(-1, 1), ylim=(-1, 1)) 

4174 ax.axline((0, 0), slope=1, transform=ax.transAxes) 

4175 ax.axline((0.5, 0.5), slope=2, color='C1', transform=ax.transAxes) 

4176 ax.axline((0.5, 0.5), slope=0, color='C2', transform=ax.transAxes) 

4177 ax.set(xlim=(0, 5), ylim=(0, 10)) 

4178 fig_test.set_size_inches(3, 3) 

4179 

4180 ax = fig_ref.subplots() 

4181 ax.set(xlim=(0, 5), ylim=(0, 10)) 

4182 fig_ref.set_size_inches(3, 3) 

4183 ax.plot([0, 5], [0, 5]) 

4184 ax.plot([0, 5], [0, 10], color='C1') 

4185 ax.plot([0, 5], [5, 5], color='C2') 

4186 

4187 

4188def test_axline_args(): 

4189 """Exactly one of *xy2* and *slope* must be specified.""" 

4190 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4191 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

4192 ax.axline((0, 0)) # missing second parameter 

4193 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

4194 ax.axline((0, 0), (1, 1), slope=1) # redundant parameters 

4195 ax.set_xscale('log') 

4196 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

4197 ax.axline((0, 0), slope=1) 

4198 ax.set_xscale('linear') 

4199 ax.set_yscale('log') 

4200 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

4201 ax.axline((0, 0), slope=1) 

4202 ax.set_yscale('linear') 

4203 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

4204 ax.axline((0, 0), (0, 0)) # two identical points are not allowed 

4205 plt.draw() 

4206 

4207 

4208@image_comparison(['vlines_basic', 'vlines_with_nan', 'vlines_masked'], 

4209 extensions=['png']) 

4210def test_vlines(): 

4211 # normal 

4212 x1 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 7] 

4213 y1 = [2, -6, 3, 8, 2] 

4214 fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots() 

4215 ax1.vlines(x1, 0, y1, colors='g', linewidth=5) 

4216 

4217 # GH #7406 

4218 x2 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] 

4219 y2 = [2, -6, 3, 8, np.nan, 2] 

4220 fig2, (ax2, ax3, ax4) = plt.subplots(nrows=3, figsize=(4, 8)) 

4221 ax2.vlines(x2, 0, y2, colors='g', linewidth=5) 

4222 

4223 x3 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] 

4224 y3 = [np.nan, 2, -6, 3, 8, 2] 

4225 ax3.vlines(x3, 0, y3, colors='r', linewidth=3, linestyle='--') 

4226 

4227 x4 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] 

4228 y4 = [np.nan, 2, -6, 3, 8, np.nan] 

4229 ax4.vlines(x4, 0, y4, colors='k', linewidth=2) 

4230 

4231 # tweak the x-axis so we can see the lines better 

4232 for ax in [ax1, ax2, ax3, ax4]: 

4233 ax.set_xlim(0, 10) 

4234 

4235 # check that the y-lims are all automatically the same 

4236 assert ax1.get_ylim() == ax2.get_ylim() 

4237 assert ax1.get_ylim() == ax3.get_ylim() 

4238 assert ax1.get_ylim() == ax4.get_ylim() 

4239 

4240 fig3, ax5 = plt.subplots() 

4241 x5 = np.ma.masked_equal([2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12], 8) 

4242 ymin5 = np.ma.masked_equal([0, 1, -1, 0, 2, 1], 2) 

4243 ymax5 = np.ma.masked_equal([13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18], 18) 

4244 ax5.vlines(x5, ymin5, ymax5, colors='k', linewidth=2) 

4245 ax5.set_xlim(0, 15) 

4246 

4247 

4248def test_vlines_default(): 

4249 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4250 with mpl.rc_context({'lines.color': 'red'}): 

4251 lines = ax.vlines(0.5, 0, 1) 

4252 assert mpl.colors.same_color(lines.get_color(), 'red') 

4253 

4254 

4255@image_comparison(['hlines_basic', 'hlines_with_nan', 'hlines_masked'], 

4256 extensions=['png']) 

4257def test_hlines(): 

4258 # normal 

4259 y1 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 7] 

4260 x1 = [2, -6, 3, 8, 2] 

4261 fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots() 

4262 ax1.hlines(y1, 0, x1, colors='g', linewidth=5) 

4263 

4264 # GH #7406 

4265 y2 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] 

4266 x2 = [2, -6, 3, 8, np.nan, 2] 

4267 fig2, (ax2, ax3, ax4) = plt.subplots(nrows=3, figsize=(4, 8)) 

4268 ax2.hlines(y2, 0, x2, colors='g', linewidth=5) 

4269 

4270 y3 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] 

4271 x3 = [np.nan, 2, -6, 3, 8, 2] 

4272 ax3.hlines(y3, 0, x3, colors='r', linewidth=3, linestyle='--') 

4273 

4274 y4 = [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] 

4275 x4 = [np.nan, 2, -6, 3, 8, np.nan] 

4276 ax4.hlines(y4, 0, x4, colors='k', linewidth=2) 

4277 

4278 # tweak the y-axis so we can see the lines better 

4279 for ax in [ax1, ax2, ax3, ax4]: 

4280 ax.set_ylim(0, 10) 

4281 

4282 # check that the x-lims are all automatically the same 

4283 assert ax1.get_xlim() == ax2.get_xlim() 

4284 assert ax1.get_xlim() == ax3.get_xlim() 

4285 assert ax1.get_xlim() == ax4.get_xlim() 

4286 

4287 fig3, ax5 = plt.subplots() 

4288 y5 = np.ma.masked_equal([2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12], 8) 

4289 xmin5 = np.ma.masked_equal([0, 1, -1, 0, 2, 1], 2) 

4290 xmax5 = np.ma.masked_equal([13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18], 18) 

4291 ax5.hlines(y5, xmin5, xmax5, colors='k', linewidth=2) 

4292 ax5.set_ylim(0, 15) 

4293 

4294 

4295def test_hlines_default(): 

4296 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4297 with mpl.rc_context({'lines.color': 'red'}): 

4298 lines = ax.hlines(0.5, 0, 1) 

4299 assert mpl.colors.same_color(lines.get_color(), 'red') 

4300 

4301 

4302@pytest.mark.parametrize('data', [[1, 2, 3, np.nan, 5], 

4303 np.ma.masked_equal([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 4)]) 

4304@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

4305def test_lines_with_colors(fig_test, fig_ref, data): 

4306 test_colors = ['red', 'green', 'blue', 'purple', 'orange'] 

4307 fig_test.add_subplot(2, 1, 1).vlines(data, 0, 1, 

4308 colors=test_colors, linewidth=5) 

4309 fig_test.add_subplot(2, 1, 2).hlines(data, 0, 1, 

4310 colors=test_colors, linewidth=5) 

4311 

4312 expect_xy = [1, 2, 3, 5] 

4313 expect_color = ['red', 'green', 'blue', 'orange'] 

4314 fig_ref.add_subplot(2, 1, 1).vlines(expect_xy, 0, 1, 

4315 colors=expect_color, linewidth=5) 

4316 fig_ref.add_subplot(2, 1, 2).hlines(expect_xy, 0, 1, 

4317 colors=expect_color, linewidth=5) 

4318 

4319 

4320@image_comparison(['step_linestyle', 'step_linestyle'], remove_text=True) 

4321def test_step_linestyle(): 

4322 x = y = np.arange(10) 

4323 

4324 # First illustrate basic pyplot interface, using defaults where possible. 

4325 fig, ax_lst = plt.subplots(2, 2) 

4326 ax_lst = ax_lst.flatten() 

4327 

4328 ln_styles = ['-', '--', '-.', ':'] 

4329 

4330 for ax, ls in zip(ax_lst, ln_styles): 

4331 ax.step(x, y, lw=5, linestyle=ls, where='pre') 

4332 ax.step(x, y + 1, lw=5, linestyle=ls, where='mid') 

4333 ax.step(x, y + 2, lw=5, linestyle=ls, where='post') 

4334 ax.set_xlim([-1, 5]) 

4335 ax.set_ylim([-1, 7]) 

4336 

4337 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

4338 data = {"X": x, "Y0": y, "Y1": y+1, "Y2": y+2} 

4339 fig, ax_lst = plt.subplots(2, 2) 

4340 ax_lst = ax_lst.flatten() 

4341 ln_styles = ['-', '--', '-.', ':'] 

4342 for ax, ls in zip(ax_lst, ln_styles): 

4343 ax.step("X", "Y0", lw=5, linestyle=ls, where='pre', data=data) 

4344 ax.step("X", "Y1", lw=5, linestyle=ls, where='mid', data=data) 

4345 ax.step("X", "Y2", lw=5, linestyle=ls, where='post', data=data) 

4346 ax.set_xlim([-1, 5]) 

4347 ax.set_ylim([-1, 7]) 

4348 

4349 

4350@image_comparison(['mixed_collection'], remove_text=True) 

4351def test_mixed_collection(): 

4352 # First illustrate basic pyplot interface, using defaults where possible. 

4353 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4354 

4355 c = mpatches.Circle((8, 8), radius=4, facecolor='none', edgecolor='green') 

4356 

4357 # PDF can optimize this one 

4358 p1 = mpl.collections.PatchCollection([c], match_original=True) 

4359 p1.set_offsets([[0, 0], [24, 24]]) 

4360 p1.set_linewidths([1, 5]) 

4361 

4362 # PDF can't optimize this one, because the alpha of the edge changes 

4363 p2 = mpl.collections.PatchCollection([c], match_original=True) 

4364 p2.set_offsets([[48, 0], [-32, -16]]) 

4365 p2.set_linewidths([1, 5]) 

4366 p2.set_edgecolors([[0, 0, 0.1, 1.0], [0, 0, 0.1, 0.5]]) 

4367 

4368 ax.patch.set_color('0.5') 

4369 ax.add_collection(p1) 

4370 ax.add_collection(p2) 

4371 

4372 ax.set_xlim(0, 16) 

4373 ax.set_ylim(0, 16) 

4374 

4375 

4376def test_subplot_key_hash(): 

4377 ax = plt.subplot(np.int32(5), np.int64(1), 1) 

4378 ax.twinx() 

4379 assert ax.get_subplotspec().get_geometry() == (5, 1, 0, 0) 

4380 

4381 

4382@image_comparison( 

4383 ["specgram_freqs.png", "specgram_freqs_linear.png", 

4384 "specgram_noise.png", "specgram_noise_linear.png"], 

4385 remove_text=True, tol=0.07, style="default") 

4386def test_specgram(): 

4387 """Test axes.specgram in default (psd) mode.""" 

4388 

4389 # use former defaults to match existing baseline image 

4390 matplotlib.rcParams['image.interpolation'] = 'nearest' 

4391 

4392 n = 1000 

4393 Fs = 10. 

4394 

4395 fstims = [[Fs/4, Fs/5, Fs/11], [Fs/4.7, Fs/5.6, Fs/11.9]] 

4396 NFFT_freqs = int(10 * Fs / np.min(fstims)) 

4397 x = np.arange(0, n, 1/Fs) 

4398 y_freqs = np.concatenate( 

4399 np.sin(2 * np.pi * np.multiply.outer(fstims, x)).sum(axis=1)) 

4400 

4401 NFFT_noise = int(10 * Fs / 11) 

4402 np.random.seed(0) 

4403 y_noise = np.concatenate([np.random.standard_normal(n), np.random.rand(n)]) 

4404 

4405 all_sides = ["default", "onesided", "twosided"] 

4406 for y, NFFT in [(y_freqs, NFFT_freqs), (y_noise, NFFT_noise)]: 

4407 noverlap = NFFT // 2 

4408 pad_to = int(2 ** np.ceil(np.log2(NFFT))) 

4409 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4410 ax.specgram(y, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, noverlap=noverlap, 

4411 pad_to=pad_to, sides=sides) 

4412 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4413 ax.specgram(y, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, noverlap=noverlap, 

4414 pad_to=pad_to, sides=sides, 

4415 scale="linear", norm=matplotlib.colors.LogNorm()) 

4416 

4417 

4418@image_comparison( 

4419 ["specgram_magnitude_freqs.png", "specgram_magnitude_freqs_linear.png", 

4420 "specgram_magnitude_noise.png", "specgram_magnitude_noise_linear.png"], 

4421 remove_text=True, tol=0.07, style="default") 

4422def test_specgram_magnitude(): 

4423 """Test axes.specgram in magnitude mode.""" 

4424 

4425 # use former defaults to match existing baseline image 

4426 matplotlib.rcParams['image.interpolation'] = 'nearest' 

4427 

4428 n = 1000 

4429 Fs = 10. 

4430 

4431 fstims = [[Fs/4, Fs/5, Fs/11], [Fs/4.7, Fs/5.6, Fs/11.9]] 

4432 NFFT_freqs = int(100 * Fs / np.min(fstims)) 

4433 x = np.arange(0, n, 1/Fs) 

4434 y = np.sin(2 * np.pi * np.multiply.outer(fstims, x)).sum(axis=1) 

4435 y[:, -1] = 1 

4436 y_freqs = np.hstack(y) 

4437 

4438 NFFT_noise = int(10 * Fs / 11) 

4439 np.random.seed(0) 

4440 y_noise = np.concatenate([np.random.standard_normal(n), np.random.rand(n)]) 

4441 

4442 all_sides = ["default", "onesided", "twosided"] 

4443 for y, NFFT in [(y_freqs, NFFT_freqs), (y_noise, NFFT_noise)]: 

4444 noverlap = NFFT // 2 

4445 pad_to = int(2 ** np.ceil(np.log2(NFFT))) 

4446 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4447 ax.specgram(y, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, noverlap=noverlap, 

4448 pad_to=pad_to, sides=sides, mode="magnitude") 

4449 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4450 ax.specgram(y, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, noverlap=noverlap, 

4451 pad_to=pad_to, sides=sides, mode="magnitude", 

4452 scale="linear", norm=matplotlib.colors.LogNorm()) 

4453 

4454 

4455@image_comparison( 

4456 ["specgram_angle_freqs.png", "specgram_phase_freqs.png", 

4457 "specgram_angle_noise.png", "specgram_phase_noise.png"], 

4458 remove_text=True, tol=0.07, style="default") 

4459def test_specgram_angle(): 

4460 """Test axes.specgram in angle and phase modes.""" 

4461 

4462 # use former defaults to match existing baseline image 

4463 matplotlib.rcParams['image.interpolation'] = 'nearest' 

4464 

4465 n = 1000 

4466 Fs = 10. 

4467 

4468 fstims = [[Fs/4, Fs/5, Fs/11], [Fs/4.7, Fs/5.6, Fs/11.9]] 

4469 NFFT_freqs = int(10 * Fs / np.min(fstims)) 

4470 x = np.arange(0, n, 1/Fs) 

4471 y = np.sin(2 * np.pi * np.multiply.outer(fstims, x)).sum(axis=1) 

4472 y[:, -1] = 1 

4473 y_freqs = np.hstack(y) 

4474 

4475 NFFT_noise = int(10 * Fs / 11) 

4476 np.random.seed(0) 

4477 y_noise = np.concatenate([np.random.standard_normal(n), np.random.rand(n)]) 

4478 

4479 all_sides = ["default", "onesided", "twosided"] 

4480 for y, NFFT in [(y_freqs, NFFT_freqs), (y_noise, NFFT_noise)]: 

4481 noverlap = NFFT // 2 

4482 pad_to = int(2 ** np.ceil(np.log2(NFFT))) 

4483 for mode in ["angle", "phase"]: 

4484 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4485 ax.specgram(y, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, noverlap=noverlap, 

4486 pad_to=pad_to, sides=sides, mode=mode) 

4487 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

4488 ax.specgram(y, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, noverlap=noverlap, 

4489 pad_to=pad_to, sides=sides, mode=mode, 

4490 scale="dB") 

4491 

4492 

4493def test_specgram_fs_none(): 

4494 """Test axes.specgram when Fs is None, should not throw error.""" 

4495 spec, freqs, t, im = plt.specgram(np.ones(300), Fs=None, scale='linear') 

4496 xmin, xmax, freq0, freq1 = im.get_extent() 

4497 assert xmin == 32 and xmax == 96 

4498 

4499 

4500@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

4501def test_specgram_origin_rcparam(fig_test, fig_ref): 

4502 """Test specgram ignores image.origin rcParam and uses origin 'upper'.""" 

4503 t = np.arange(500) 

4504 signal = np.sin(t) 

4505 

4506 plt.rcParams["image.origin"] = 'upper' 

4507 

4508 # Reference: First graph using default origin in imshow (upper), 

4509 fig_ref.subplots().specgram(signal) 

4510 

4511 # Try to overwrite the setting trying to flip the specgram 

4512 plt.rcParams["image.origin"] = 'lower' 

4513 

4514 # Test: origin='lower' should be ignored 

4515 fig_test.subplots().specgram(signal) 

4516 

4517 

4518def test_specgram_origin_kwarg(): 

4519 """Ensure passing origin as a kwarg raises a TypeError.""" 

4520 t = np.arange(500) 

4521 signal = np.sin(t) 

4522 

4523 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

4524 plt.specgram(signal, origin='lower') 

4525 

4526 

4527@image_comparison( 

4528 ["psd_freqs.png", "csd_freqs.png", "psd_noise.png", "csd_noise.png"], 

4529 remove_text=True, tol=0.002) 

4530def test_psd_csd(): 

4531 n = 10000 

4532 Fs = 100. 

4533 

4534 fstims = [[Fs/4, Fs/5, Fs/11], [Fs/4.7, Fs/5.6, Fs/11.9]] 

4535 NFFT_freqs = int(1000 * Fs / np.min(fstims)) 

4536 x = np.arange(0, n, 1/Fs) 

4537 ys_freqs = np.sin(2 * np.pi * np.multiply.outer(fstims, x)).sum(axis=1) 

4538 

4539 NFFT_noise = int(1000 * Fs / 11) 

4540 np.random.seed(0) 

4541 ys_noise = [np.random.standard_normal(n), np.random.rand(n)] 

4542 

4543 all_kwargs = [{"sides": "default"}, 

4544 {"sides": "onesided", "return_line": False}, 

4545 {"sides": "twosided", "return_line": True}] 

4546 for ys, NFFT in [(ys_freqs, NFFT_freqs), (ys_noise, NFFT_noise)]: 

4547 noverlap = NFFT // 2 

4548 pad_to = int(2 ** np.ceil(np.log2(NFFT))) 

4549 for ax, kwargs in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_kwargs): 

4550 ret = ax.psd(np.concatenate(ys), NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, 

4551 noverlap=noverlap, pad_to=pad_to, **kwargs) 

4552 assert len(ret) == 2 + kwargs.get("return_line", False) 

4553 ax.set(xlabel="", ylabel="") 

4554 for ax, kwargs in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_kwargs): 

4555 ret = ax.csd(*ys, NFFT=NFFT, Fs=Fs, 

4556 noverlap=noverlap, pad_to=pad_to, **kwargs) 

4557 assert len(ret) == 2 + kwargs.get("return_line", False) 

4558 ax.set(xlabel="", ylabel="") 

4559 

4560 

4561@image_comparison( 

4562 ["magnitude_spectrum_freqs_linear.png", 

4563 "magnitude_spectrum_freqs_dB.png", 

4564 "angle_spectrum_freqs.png", 

4565 "phase_spectrum_freqs.png", 

4566 "magnitude_spectrum_noise_linear.png", 

4567 "magnitude_spectrum_noise_dB.png", 

4568 "angle_spectrum_noise.png", 

4569 "phase_spectrum_noise.png"], 

4570 remove_text=True) 

4571def test_spectrum(): 

4572 n = 10000 

4573 Fs = 100. 

4574 

4575 fstims1 = [Fs/4, Fs/5, Fs/11] 

4576 NFFT = int(1000 * Fs / min(fstims1)) 

4577 pad_to = int(2 ** np.ceil(np.log2(NFFT))) 

4578 

4579 x = np.arange(0, n, 1/Fs) 

4580 y_freqs = ((np.sin(2 * np.pi * np.outer(x, fstims1)) * 10**np.arange(3)) 

4581 .sum(axis=1)) 

4582 np.random.seed(0) 

4583 y_noise = np.hstack([np.random.standard_normal(n), np.random.rand(n)]) - .5 

4584 

4585 all_sides = ["default", "onesided", "twosided"] 

4586 kwargs = {"Fs": Fs, "pad_to": pad_to} 

4587 for y in [y_freqs, y_noise]: 

4588 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4589 spec, freqs, line = ax.magnitude_spectrum(y, sides=sides, **kwargs) 

4590 ax.set(xlabel="", ylabel="") 

4591 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4592 spec, freqs, line = ax.magnitude_spectrum(y, sides=sides, **kwargs, 

4593 scale="dB") 

4594 ax.set(xlabel="", ylabel="") 

4595 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4596 spec, freqs, line = ax.angle_spectrum(y, sides=sides, **kwargs) 

4597 ax.set(xlabel="", ylabel="") 

4598 for ax, sides in zip(plt.figure().subplots(3), all_sides): 

4599 spec, freqs, line = ax.phase_spectrum(y, sides=sides, **kwargs) 

4600 ax.set(xlabel="", ylabel="") 

4601 

4602 

4603@image_comparison(['twin_spines.png'], remove_text=True) 

4604def test_twin_spines(): 

4605 

4606 def make_patch_spines_invisible(ax): 

4607 ax.set_frame_on(True) 

4608 ax.patch.set_visible(False) 

4609 ax.spines[:].set_visible(False) 

4610 

4611 fig = plt.figure(figsize=(4, 3)) 

4612 fig.subplots_adjust(right=0.75) 

4613 

4614 host = fig.add_subplot() 

4615 par1 = host.twinx() 

4616 par2 = host.twinx() 

4617 

4618 # Offset the right spine of par2. The ticks and label have already been 

4619 # placed on the right by twinx above. 

4620 par2.spines.right.set_position(("axes", 1.2)) 

4621 # Having been created by twinx, par2 has its frame off, so the line of 

4622 # its detached spine is invisible. First, activate the frame but make 

4623 # the patch and spines invisible. 

4624 make_patch_spines_invisible(par2) 

4625 # Second, show the right spine. 

4626 par2.spines.right.set_visible(True) 

4627 

4628 p1, = host.plot([0, 1, 2], [0, 1, 2], "b-") 

4629 p2, = par1.plot([0, 1, 2], [0, 3, 2], "r-") 

4630 p3, = par2.plot([0, 1, 2], [50, 30, 15], "g-") 

4631 

4632 host.set_xlim(0, 2) 

4633 host.set_ylim(0, 2) 

4634 par1.set_ylim(0, 4) 

4635 par2.set_ylim(1, 65) 

4636 

4637 host.yaxis.label.set_color(p1.get_color()) 

4638 par1.yaxis.label.set_color(p2.get_color()) 

4639 par2.yaxis.label.set_color(p3.get_color()) 

4640 

4641 tkw = dict(size=4, width=1.5) 

4642 host.tick_params(axis='y', colors=p1.get_color(), **tkw) 

4643 par1.tick_params(axis='y', colors=p2.get_color(), **tkw) 

4644 par2.tick_params(axis='y', colors=p3.get_color(), **tkw) 

4645 host.tick_params(axis='x', **tkw) 

4646 

4647 

4648@image_comparison(['twin_spines_on_top.png', 'twin_spines_on_top.png'], 

4649 remove_text=True) 

4650def test_twin_spines_on_top(): 

4651 matplotlib.rcParams['axes.linewidth'] = 48.0 

4652 matplotlib.rcParams['lines.linewidth'] = 48.0 

4653 

4654 fig = plt.figure() 

4655 ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1) 

4656 

4657 data = np.array([[1000, 1100, 1200, 1250], 

4658 [310, 301, 360, 400]]) 

4659 

4660 ax2 = ax1.twinx() 

4661 

4662 ax1.plot(data[0], data[1]/1E3, color='#BEAED4') 

4663 ax1.fill_between(data[0], data[1]/1E3, color='#BEAED4', alpha=.8) 

4664 

4665 ax2.plot(data[0], data[1]/1E3, color='#7FC97F') 

4666 ax2.fill_between(data[0], data[1]/1E3, color='#7FC97F', alpha=.5) 

4667 

4668 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

4669 data = {"i": data[0], "j": data[1]/1E3} 

4670 fig = plt.figure() 

4671 ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1) 

4672 ax2 = ax1.twinx() 

4673 ax1.plot("i", "j", color='#BEAED4', data=data) 

4674 ax1.fill_between("i", "j", color='#BEAED4', alpha=.8, data=data) 

4675 ax2.plot("i", "j", color='#7FC97F', data=data) 

4676 ax2.fill_between("i", "j", color='#7FC97F', alpha=.5, data=data) 

4677 

4678 

4679@pytest.mark.parametrize("grid_which, major_visible, minor_visible", [ 

4680 ("both", True, True), 

4681 ("major", True, False), 

4682 ("minor", False, True), 

4683]) 

4684def test_rcparam_grid_minor(grid_which, major_visible, minor_visible): 

4685 mpl.rcParams.update({"axes.grid": True, "axes.grid.which": grid_which}) 

4686 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4687 fig.canvas.draw() 

4688 assert all(tick.gridline.get_visible() == major_visible 

4689 for tick in ax.xaxis.majorTicks) 

4690 assert all(tick.gridline.get_visible() == minor_visible 

4691 for tick in ax.xaxis.minorTicks) 

4692 

4693 

4694def test_grid(): 

4695 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4696 ax.grid() 

4697 fig.canvas.draw() 

4698 assert ax.xaxis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_visible() 

4699 ax.grid(visible=False) 

4700 fig.canvas.draw() 

4701 assert not ax.xaxis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_visible() 

4702 ax.grid(visible=True) 

4703 fig.canvas.draw() 

4704 assert ax.xaxis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_visible() 

4705 ax.grid() 

4706 fig.canvas.draw() 

4707 assert not ax.xaxis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_visible() 

4708 

4709 

4710def test_vline_limit(): 

4711 fig = plt.figure() 

4712 ax = fig.gca() 

4713 ax.axvline(0.5) 

4714 ax.plot([-0.1, 0, 0.2, 0.1]) 

4715 assert_allclose(ax.get_ylim(), (-.1, .2)) 

4716 

4717 

4718@pytest.mark.parametrize('fv, fh, args', [[plt.axvline, plt.axhline, (1,)], 

4719 [plt.axvspan, plt.axhspan, (1, 1)]]) 

4720def test_axline_minmax(fv, fh, args): 

4721 bad_lim = matplotlib.dates.num2date(1) 

4722 # Check vertical functions 

4723 with pytest.raises(ValueError, match='ymin must be a single scalar value'): 

4724 fv(*args, ymin=bad_lim, ymax=1) 

4725 with pytest.raises(ValueError, match='ymax must be a single scalar value'): 

4726 fv(*args, ymin=1, ymax=bad_lim) 

4727 # Check horizontal functions 

4728 with pytest.raises(ValueError, match='xmin must be a single scalar value'): 

4729 fh(*args, xmin=bad_lim, xmax=1) 

4730 with pytest.raises(ValueError, match='xmax must be a single scalar value'): 

4731 fh(*args, xmin=1, xmax=bad_lim) 

4732 

4733 

4734def test_empty_shared_subplots(): 

4735 # empty plots with shared axes inherit limits from populated plots 

4736 fig, axs = plt.subplots(nrows=1, ncols=2, sharex=True, sharey=True) 

4737 axs[0].plot([1, 2, 3], [2, 4, 6]) 

4738 x0, x1 = axs[1].get_xlim() 

4739 y0, y1 = axs[1].get_ylim() 

4740 assert x0 <= 1 

4741 assert x1 >= 3 

4742 assert y0 <= 2 

4743 assert y1 >= 6 

4744 

4745 

4746def test_shared_with_aspect_1(): 

4747 # allow sharing one axis 

4748 for adjustable in ['box', 'datalim']: 

4749 fig, axs = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True) 

4750 axs[0].set_aspect(2, adjustable=adjustable, share=True) 

4751 assert axs[1].get_aspect() == 2 

4752 assert axs[1].get_adjustable() == adjustable 

4753 

4754 fig, axs = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True) 

4755 axs[0].set_aspect(2, adjustable=adjustable) 

4756 assert axs[1].get_aspect() == 'auto' 

4757 

4758 

4759def test_shared_with_aspect_2(): 

4760 # Share 2 axes only with 'box': 

4761 fig, axs = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharex=True, sharey=True) 

4762 axs[0].set_aspect(2, share=True) 

4763 axs[0].plot([1, 2], [3, 4]) 

4764 axs[1].plot([3, 4], [1, 2]) 

4765 plt.draw() # Trigger apply_aspect(). 

4766 assert axs[0].get_xlim() == axs[1].get_xlim() 

4767 assert axs[0].get_ylim() == axs[1].get_ylim() 

4768 

4769 

4770def test_shared_with_aspect_3(): 

4771 # Different aspect ratios: 

4772 for adjustable in ['box', 'datalim']: 

4773 fig, axs = plt.subplots(nrows=2, sharey=True) 

4774 axs[0].set_aspect(2, adjustable=adjustable) 

4775 axs[1].set_aspect(0.5, adjustable=adjustable) 

4776 axs[0].plot([1, 2], [3, 4]) 

4777 axs[1].plot([3, 4], [1, 2]) 

4778 plt.draw() # Trigger apply_aspect(). 

4779 assert axs[0].get_xlim() != axs[1].get_xlim() 

4780 assert axs[0].get_ylim() == axs[1].get_ylim() 

4781 fig_aspect = fig.bbox_inches.height / fig.bbox_inches.width 

4782 for ax in axs: 

4783 p = ax.get_position() 

4784 box_aspect = p.height / p.width 

4785 lim_aspect = ax.viewLim.height / ax.viewLim.width 

4786 expected = fig_aspect * box_aspect / lim_aspect 

4787 assert round(expected, 4) == round(ax.get_aspect(), 4) 

4788 

4789 

4790@pytest.mark.parametrize('twin', ('x', 'y')) 

4791def test_twin_with_aspect(twin): 

4792 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

4793 # test twinx or twiny 

4794 ax_twin = getattr(ax, 'twin{}'.format(twin))() 

4795 ax.set_aspect(5) 

4796 ax_twin.set_aspect(2) 

4797 assert_array_equal(ax.bbox.extents, 

4798 ax_twin.bbox.extents) 

4799 

4800 

4801def test_relim_visible_only(): 

4802 x1 = (0., 10.) 

4803 y1 = (0., 10.) 

4804 x2 = (-10., 20.) 

4805 y2 = (-10., 30.) 

4806 

4807 fig = matplotlib.figure.Figure() 

4808 ax = fig.add_subplot() 

4809 ax.plot(x1, y1) 

4810 assert ax.get_xlim() == x1 

4811 assert ax.get_ylim() == y1 

4812 line, = ax.plot(x2, y2) 

4813 assert ax.get_xlim() == x2 

4814 assert ax.get_ylim() == y2 

4815 line.set_visible(False) 

4816 assert ax.get_xlim() == x2 

4817 assert ax.get_ylim() == y2 

4818 

4819 ax.relim(visible_only=True) 

4820 ax.autoscale_view() 

4821 

4822 assert ax.get_xlim() == x1 

4823 assert ax.get_ylim() == y1 

4824 

4825 

4826def test_text_labelsize(): 

4827 """ 

4828 tests for issue #1172 

4829 """ 

4830 fig = plt.figure() 

4831 ax = fig.gca() 

4832 ax.tick_params(labelsize='large') 

4833 ax.tick_params(direction='out') 

4834 

4835 

4836@image_comparison(['pie_default.png']) 

4837def test_pie_default(): 

4838 # The slices will be ordered and plotted counter-clockwise. 

4839 labels = 'Frogs', 'Hogs', 'Dogs', 'Logs' 

4840 sizes = [15, 30, 45, 10] 

4841 colors = ['yellowgreen', 'gold', 'lightskyblue', 'lightcoral'] 

4842 explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0) # only "explode" the 2nd slice (i.e. 'Hogs') 

4843 fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 6)) 

4844 ax1.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4845 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90) 

4846 

4847 

4848@image_comparison(['pie_linewidth_0', 'pie_linewidth_0', 'pie_linewidth_0'], 

4849 extensions=['png']) 

4850def test_pie_linewidth_0(): 

4851 # The slices will be ordered and plotted counter-clockwise. 

4852 labels = 'Frogs', 'Hogs', 'Dogs', 'Logs' 

4853 sizes = [15, 30, 45, 10] 

4854 colors = ['yellowgreen', 'gold', 'lightskyblue', 'lightcoral'] 

4855 explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0) # only "explode" the 2nd slice (i.e. 'Hogs') 

4856 

4857 plt.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4858 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4859 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}) 

4860 # Set aspect ratio to be equal so that pie is drawn as a circle. 

4861 plt.axis('equal') 

4862 

4863 # Reuse testcase from above for a labeled data test 

4864 data = {"l": labels, "s": sizes, "c": colors, "ex": explode} 

4865 fig = plt.figure() 

4866 ax = fig.gca() 

4867 ax.pie("s", explode="ex", labels="l", colors="c", 

4868 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4869 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}, data=data) 

4870 ax.axis('equal') 

4871 

4872 # And again to test the pyplot functions which should also be able to be 

4873 # called with a data kwarg 

4874 plt.figure() 

4875 plt.pie("s", explode="ex", labels="l", colors="c", 

4876 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4877 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}, data=data) 

4878 plt.axis('equal') 

4879 

4880 

4881@image_comparison(['pie_center_radius.png']) 

4882def test_pie_center_radius(): 

4883 # The slices will be ordered and plotted counter-clockwise. 

4884 labels = 'Frogs', 'Hogs', 'Dogs', 'Logs' 

4885 sizes = [15, 30, 45, 10] 

4886 colors = ['yellowgreen', 'gold', 'lightskyblue', 'lightcoral'] 

4887 explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0) # only "explode" the 2nd slice (i.e. 'Hogs') 

4888 

4889 plt.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4890 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4891 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}, center=(1, 2), radius=1.5) 

4892 

4893 plt.annotate("Center point", xy=(1, 2), xytext=(1, 1.5), 

4894 arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->", 

4895 connectionstyle="arc3")) 

4896 # Set aspect ratio to be equal so that pie is drawn as a circle. 

4897 plt.axis('equal')

4930@image_comparison(['pie_frame_grid.png']) 

4931def test_pie_frame_grid(): 

4932 # The slices will be ordered and plotted counter-clockwise. 

4933 labels = 'Frogs', 'Hogs', 'Dogs', 'Logs' 

4934 sizes = [15, 30, 45, 10] 

4935 colors = ['yellowgreen', 'gold', 'lightskyblue', 'lightcoral'] 

4936 # only "explode" the 2nd slice (i.e. 'Hogs') 

4937 explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0) 

4938 

4939 plt.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4940 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4941 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}, 

4942 frame=True, center=(2, 2)) 

4943 

4944 plt.pie(sizes[::-1], explode=explode, labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4945 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4946 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}, 

4947 frame=True, center=(5, 2)) 

4948 

4949 plt.pie(sizes, explode=explode[::-1], labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4950 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, 

4951 wedgeprops={'linewidth': 0}, 

4952 frame=True, center=(3, 5)) 

4953 # Set aspect ratio to be equal so that pie is drawn as a circle. 

4954 plt.axis('equal')

4972@image_comparison(['pie_no_label.png']) 

4973def test_pie_nolabel_but_legend(): 

4974 labels = 'Frogs', 'Hogs', 'Dogs', 'Logs' 

4975 sizes = [15, 30, 45, 10] 

4976 colors = ['yellowgreen', 'gold', 'lightskyblue', 'lightcoral'] 

4977 explode = (0, 0.1, 0, 0) # only "explode" the 2nd slice (i.e. 'Hogs') 

4978 plt.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, colors=colors, 

4979 autopct='%1.1f%%', shadow=True, startangle=90, labeldistance=None, 

4980 rotatelabels=True) 

4981 plt.axis('equal') 

4982 plt.ylim(-1.2, 1.2) 

4983 plt.legend() 

4984 

4985 

4986def test_pie_textprops(): 

4987 data = [23, 34, 45] 

4988 labels = ["Long name 1", "Long name 2", "Long name 3"] 

4989 

4990 textprops = dict(horizontalalignment="center", 

4991 verticalalignment="top", 

4992 rotation=90, 

4993 rotation_mode="anchor", 

4994 size=12, color="red") 

4995 

4996 _, texts, autopct = plt.gca().pie(data, labels=labels, autopct='%.2f', 

4997 textprops=textprops) 

4998 for labels in [texts, autopct]: 

4999 for tx in labels: 

5000 assert tx.get_ha() == textprops["horizontalalignment"] 

5001 assert tx.get_va() == textprops["verticalalignment"] 

5002 assert tx.get_rotation() == textprops["rotation"] 

5003 assert tx.get_rotation_mode() == textprops["rotation_mode"] 

5004 assert tx.get_size() == textprops["size"] 

5005 assert tx.get_color() == textprops["color"] 

5006 

5007 

5008def test_pie_get_negative_values(): 

5009 # Test the ValueError raised when feeding negative values into axes.pie 

5010 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5011 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5012 ax.pie([5, 5, -3], explode=[0, .1, .2]) 

5013 

5014 

5015def test_normalize_kwarg_warn_pie(): 

5016 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5017 with pytest.warns(MatplotlibDeprecationWarning): 

5018 ax.pie(x=[0], normalize=None) 

5019 

5020 

5021def test_normalize_kwarg_pie(): 

5022 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5023 x = [0.3, 0.3, 0.1] 

5024 t1 = ax.pie(x=x, normalize=True) 

5025 assert abs(t1[0][-1].theta2 - 360.) < 1e-3 

5026 t2 = ax.pie(x=x, normalize=False) 

5027 assert abs(t2[0][-1].theta2 - 360.) > 1e-3 

5028 

5029 

5030@image_comparison(['set_get_ticklabels.png']) 

5031def test_set_get_ticklabels(): 

5032 # test issue 2246 

5033 fig, ax = plt.subplots(2) 

5034 ha = ['normal', 'set_x/yticklabels'] 

5035 

5036 ax[0].plot(np.arange(10)) 

5037 ax[0].set_title(ha[0]) 

5038 

5039 ax[1].plot(np.arange(10)) 

5040 ax[1].set_title(ha[1]) 

5041 

5042 # set ticklabel to 1 plot in normal way 

5043 ax[0].set_xticks(range(10)) 

5044 ax[0].set_yticks(range(10)) 

5045 ax[0].set_xticklabels(['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'] + 6 * ['']) 

5046 ax[0].set_yticklabels(['11', '12', '13', '14'] + 6 * ['']) 

5047 

5048 # set ticklabel to the other plot, expect the 2 plots have same label 

5049 # setting pass get_ticklabels return value as ticklabels argument 

5050 ax[1].set_xticks(ax[0].get_xticks()) 

5051 ax[1].set_yticks(ax[0].get_yticks()) 

5052 ax[1].set_xticklabels(ax[0].get_xticklabels()) 

5053 ax[1].set_yticklabels(ax[0].get_yticklabels()) 

5054 

5055 

5056def test_subsampled_ticklabels(): 

5057 # test issue 11937 

5058 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5059 ax.plot(np.arange(10)) 

5060 ax.xaxis.set_ticks(np.arange(10) + 0.1) 

5061 ax.locator_params(nbins=5) 

5062 ax.xaxis.set_ticklabels([c for c in "bcdefghijk"]) 

5063 plt.draw() 

5064 labels = [t.get_text() for t in ax.xaxis.get_ticklabels()] 

5065 assert labels == ['b', 'd', 'f', 'h', 'j'] 

5066 

5067 

5068def test_mismatched_ticklabels(): 

5069 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5070 ax.plot(np.arange(10)) 

5071 ax.xaxis.set_ticks([1.5, 2.5]) 

5072 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5073 ax.xaxis.set_ticklabels(['a', 'b', 'c']) 

5074 

5075 

5076def test_empty_ticks_fixed_loc(): 

5077 # Smoke test that [] can be used to unset all tick labels 

5078 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5079 ax.bar([1, 2], [1, 2]) 

5080 ax.set_xticks([1, 2]) 

5081 ax.set_xticklabels([]) 

5082 

5083 

5084@image_comparison(['retain_tick_visibility.png']) 

5085def test_retain_tick_visibility(): 

5086 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5087 plt.plot([0, 1, 2], [0, -1, 4]) 

5088 plt.setp(ax.get_yticklabels(), visible=False) 

5089 ax.tick_params(axis="y", which="both", length=0) 

5090 

5091 

5092def test_tick_label_update(): 

5093 # test issue 9397 

5094 

5095 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5096 

5097 # Set up a dummy formatter 

5098 def formatter_func(x, pos): 

5099 return "unit value" if x == 1 else "" 

5100 ax.xaxis.set_major_formatter(plt.FuncFormatter(formatter_func)) 

5101 

5102 # Force some of the x-axis ticks to be outside of the drawn range 

5103 ax.set_xticks([-1, 0, 1, 2, 3]) 

5104 ax.set_xlim(-0.5, 2.5) 

5105 

5106 ax.figure.canvas.draw() 

5107 tick_texts = [tick.get_text() for tick in ax.xaxis.get_ticklabels()] 

5108 assert tick_texts == ["", "", "unit value", "", ""] 

5109 

5110 

5111@image_comparison(['o_marker_path_snap.png'], savefig_kwarg={'dpi': 72}) 

5112def test_o_marker_path_snap(): 

5113 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5114 ax.margins(.1) 

5115 for ms in range(1, 15): 

5116 ax.plot([1, 2, ], np.ones(2) + ms, 'o', ms=ms) 

5117 

5118 for ms in np.linspace(1, 10, 25): 

5119 ax.plot([3, 4, ], np.ones(2) + ms, 'o', ms=ms) 

5120 

5121 

5122def test_margins(): 

5123 # test all ways margins can be called 

5124 data = [1, 10] 

5125 xmin = 0.0 

5126 xmax = len(data) - 1.0 

5127 ymin = min(data) 

5128 ymax = max(data) 

5129 

5130 fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

5131 ax1.plot(data) 

5132 ax1.margins(1) 

5133 assert ax1.margins() == (1, 1) 

5134 assert ax1.get_xlim() == (xmin - (xmax - xmin) * 1, 

5135 xmax + (xmax - xmin) * 1) 

5136 assert ax1.get_ylim() == (ymin - (ymax - ymin) * 1, 

5137 ymax + (ymax - ymin) * 1) 

5138 

5139 fig2, ax2 = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

5140 ax2.plot(data) 

5141 ax2.margins(0.5, 2) 

5142 assert ax2.margins() == (0.5, 2) 

5143 assert ax2.get_xlim() == (xmin - (xmax - xmin) * 0.5, 

5144 xmax + (xmax - xmin) * 0.5) 

5145 assert ax2.get_ylim() == (ymin - (ymax - ymin) * 2, 

5146 ymax + (ymax - ymin) * 2) 

5147 

5148 fig3, ax3 = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

5149 ax3.plot(data) 

5150 ax3.margins(x=-0.2, y=0.5) 

5151 assert ax3.margins() == (-0.2, 0.5) 

5152 assert ax3.get_xlim() == (xmin - (xmax - xmin) * -0.2, 

5153 xmax + (xmax - xmin) * -0.2) 

5154 assert ax3.get_ylim() == (ymin - (ymax - ymin) * 0.5, 

5155 ymax + (ymax - ymin) * 0.5) 

5156 

5157 

5158def test_set_margin_updates_limits(): 

5159 mpl.style.use("default") 

5160 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5161 ax.plot([1, 2], [1, 2]) 

5162 ax.set(xscale="log", xmargin=0) 

5163 assert ax.get_xlim() == (1, 2) 

5164

5168 ax.hist(1) 

5169 ax.hist([1])

5176 ax.hexbin(mylist, mylist) 

5177 fig.savefig(io.BytesIO()) # Check that no warning is emitted.

5186def test_color_alias():

5190 assert 'lime' == line.get_color()

5198 

5199def test_unicode_hist_label(): 

5200 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5201 a = (b'\xe5\xbe\x88\xe6\xbc\x82\xe4\xba\xae, ' + 

5202 b'r\xc3\xb6m\xc3\xa4n ch\xc3\xa4r\xc3\xa1ct\xc3\xa8rs') 

5203 b = b'\xd7\xa9\xd7\x9c\xd7\x95\xd7\x9d' 

5204 labels = [a.decode('utf-8'), 

5205 'hi aardvark', 

5206 b.decode('utf-8'), 

5207 ] 

5208 

5209 ax.hist([range(15)] * 3, label=labels) 

5210 ax.legend() 

5211 

5212 

5213def test_move_offsetlabel(): 

5214 data = np.random.random(10) * 1e-22 

5215 

5216 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5217 ax.plot(data) 

5218 fig.canvas.draw() 

5219 before = ax.yaxis.offsetText.get_position() 

5220 assert ax.yaxis.offsetText.get_horizontalalignment() == 'left' 

5221 ax.yaxis.tick_right() 

5222 fig.canvas.draw() 

5223 after = ax.yaxis.offsetText.get_position() 

5224 assert after[0] > before[0] and after[1] == before[1] 

5225 assert ax.yaxis.offsetText.get_horizontalalignment() == 'right' 

5226 

5227 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5228 ax.plot(data) 

5229 fig.canvas.draw() 

5230 before = ax.xaxis.offsetText.get_position() 

5231 assert ax.xaxis.offsetText.get_verticalalignment() == 'top' 

5232 ax.xaxis.tick_top() 

5233 fig.canvas.draw() 

5234 after = ax.xaxis.offsetText.get_position() 

5235 assert after[0] == before[0] and after[1] > before[1] 

5236 assert ax.xaxis.offsetText.get_verticalalignment() == 'bottom' 

5237 

5238 

5239@image_comparison(['rc_spines.png'], savefig_kwarg={'dpi': 40}) 

5240def test_rc_spines(): 

5241 rc_dict = { 

5242 'axes.spines.left': False, 

5243 'axes.spines.right': False, 

5244 'axes.spines.top': False, 

5245 'axes.spines.bottom': False} 

5246 with matplotlib.rc_context(rc_dict): 

5247 plt.subplots() # create a figure and axes with the spine properties 

5248 

5249 

5250@image_comparison(['rc_grid.png'], savefig_kwarg={'dpi': 40}) 

5251def test_rc_grid(): 

5252 fig = plt.figure() 

5253 rc_dict0 = { 

5254 'axes.grid': True, 

5255 'axes.grid.axis': 'both' 

5256 } 

5257 rc_dict1 = { 

5258 'axes.grid': True, 

5259 'axes.grid.axis': 'x' 

5260 } 

5261 rc_dict2 = { 

5262 'axes.grid': True, 

5263 'axes.grid.axis': 'y' 

5264 } 

5265 dict_list = [rc_dict0, rc_dict1, rc_dict2] 

5266 

5267 for i, rc_dict in enumerate(dict_list, 1): 

5268 with matplotlib.rc_context(rc_dict): 

5269 fig.add_subplot(3, 1, i) 

5270 

5271 

5272def test_rc_tick(): 

5273 d = {'xtick.bottom': False, 'xtick.top': True, 

5274 'ytick.left': True, 'ytick.right': False} 

5275 with plt.rc_context(rc=d): 

5276 fig = plt.figure() 

5277 ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1) 

5278 xax = ax1.xaxis 

5279 yax = ax1.yaxis 

5280 # tick1On bottom/left 

5281 assert not xax._major_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5282 assert xax._major_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5283 assert not xax._minor_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5284 assert xax._minor_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5285 

5286 assert yax._major_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5287 assert not yax._major_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5288 assert yax._minor_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5289 assert not yax._minor_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5290 

5291 

5292def test_rc_major_minor_tick(): 

5293 d = {'xtick.top': True, 'ytick.right': True, # Enable all ticks 

5294 'xtick.bottom': True, 'ytick.left': True, 

5295 # Selectively disable 

5296 'xtick.minor.bottom': False, 'xtick.major.bottom': False, 

5297 'ytick.major.left': False, 'ytick.minor.left': False} 

5298 with plt.rc_context(rc=d): 

5299 fig = plt.figure() 

5300 ax1 = fig.add_subplot(1, 1, 1) 

5301 xax = ax1.xaxis 

5302 yax = ax1.yaxis 

5303 # tick1On bottom/left 

5304 assert not xax._major_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5305 assert xax._major_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5306 assert not xax._minor_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5307 assert xax._minor_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5308 

5309 assert not yax._major_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5310 assert yax._major_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5311 assert not yax._minor_tick_kw['tick1On'] 

5312 assert yax._minor_tick_kw['tick2On'] 

5313 

5314 

5315def test_square_plot(): 

5316 x = np.arange(4) 

5317 y = np.array([1., 3., 5., 7.]) 

5318 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5319 ax.plot(x, y, 'mo') 

5320 ax.axis('square') 

5321 xlim, ylim = ax.get_xlim(), ax.get_ylim() 

5322 assert np.diff(xlim) == np.diff(ylim) 

5323 assert ax.get_aspect() == 1 

5324 assert_array_almost_equal( 

5325 ax.get_position(original=True).extents, (0.125, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9)) 

5326 assert_array_almost_equal( 

5327 ax.get_position(original=False).extents, (0.2125, 0.1, 0.8125, 0.9)) 

5328 

5329 

5330def test_bad_plot_args(): 

5331 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5332 plt.plot(None) 

5333 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5334 plt.plot(None, None) 

5335 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5336 plt.plot(np.zeros((2, 2)), np.zeros((2, 3))) 

5337 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5338 plt.plot((np.arange(5).reshape((1, -1)), np.arange(5).reshape(-1, 1))) 

5339 

5340 

5341@pytest.mark.parametrize( 

5342 "xy, cls", [ 

5343 ((), mpl.image.AxesImage), # (0, N) 

5344 (((3, 7), (2, 6)), mpl.image.AxesImage), # (xmin, xmax) 

5345 ((range(5), range(4)), mpl.image.AxesImage), # regular grid 

5346 (([1, 2, 4, 8, 16], [0, 1, 2, 3]), # irregular grid 

5347 mpl.image.PcolorImage), 

5348 ((np.random.random((4, 5)), np.random.random((4, 5))), # 2D coords 

5349 mpl.collections.QuadMesh), 

5350 ] 

5351) 

5352@pytest.mark.parametrize( 

5353 "data", [np.arange(12).reshape((3, 4)), np.random.rand(3, 4, 3)] 

5354) 

5355def test_pcolorfast(xy, data, cls): 

5356 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5357 assert type(ax.pcolorfast(*xy, data)) == cls 

5358 

5359 

5360def test_shared_scale(): 

5361 fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 2, sharex=True, sharey=True) 

5362 

5363 axs[0, 0].set_xscale("log") 

5364 axs[0, 0].set_yscale("log") 

5365 

5366 for ax in axs.flat: 

5367 assert ax.get_yscale() == 'log' 

5368 assert ax.get_xscale() == 'log' 

5369 

5370 axs[1, 1].set_xscale("linear") 

5371 axs[1, 1].set_yscale("linear") 

5372 

5373 for ax in axs.flat: 

5374 assert ax.get_yscale() == 'linear' 

5375 assert ax.get_xscale() == 'linear' 

5376 

5377 

5378def test_shared_bool(): 

5379 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

5380 plt.subplot(sharex=True) 

5381 with pytest.raises(TypeError): 

5382 plt.subplot(sharey=True)
