5384 

5385def test_violin_point_mass(): 

5386 """Violin plot should handle point mass pdf gracefully.""" 

5387 plt.violinplot(np.array([0, 0])) 

5388 

5389 

5390def generate_errorbar_inputs(): 

5391 base_xy = cycler('x', [np.arange(5)]) + cycler('y', [np.ones(5)]) 

5392 err_cycler = cycler('err', [1, 

5393 [1, 1, 1, 1, 1], 

5394 [[1, 1, 1, 1, 1], 

5395 [1, 1, 1, 1, 1]], 

5396 np.ones(5), 

5397 np.ones((2, 5)), 

5398 None 

5399 ]) 

5400 xerr_cy = cycler('xerr', err_cycler) 

5401 yerr_cy = cycler('yerr', err_cycler) 

5402 

5403 empty = ((cycler('x', [[]]) + cycler('y', [[]])) * 

5404 cycler('xerr', [[], None]) * cycler('yerr', [[], None])) 

5405 xerr_only = base_xy * xerr_cy 

5406 yerr_only = base_xy * yerr_cy 

5407 both_err = base_xy * yerr_cy * xerr_cy 

5408 

5409 return [*xerr_only, *yerr_only, *both_err, *empty] 

5410 

5411 

5412@pytest.mark.parametrize('kwargs', generate_errorbar_inputs()) 

5413def test_errorbar_inputs_shotgun(kwargs): 

5414 ax = plt.gca() 

5415 eb = ax.errorbar(**kwargs) 

5416 eb.remove() 

5417 

5418 

5419@image_comparison(["dash_offset"], remove_text=True) 

5420def test_dash_offset(): 

5421 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5422 x = np.linspace(0, 10) 

5423 y = np.ones_like(x) 

5424 for j in range(0, 100, 2): 

5425 ax.plot(x, j*y, ls=(j, (10, 10)), lw=5, color='k') 

5426 

5427 

5428def test_title_pad(): 

5429 # check that title padding puts the title in the right 

5430 # place... 

5431 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5432 ax.set_title('aardvark', pad=30.) 

5433 m = ax.titleOffsetTrans.get_matrix() 

5434 assert m[1, -1] == (30. / 72. * fig.dpi) 

5435 ax.set_title('aardvark', pad=0.) 

5436 m = ax.titleOffsetTrans.get_matrix() 

5437 assert m[1, -1] == 0. 

5438 # check that it is reverted... 

5439 ax.set_title('aardvark', pad=None) 

5440 m = ax.titleOffsetTrans.get_matrix() 

5441 assert m[1, -1] == (matplotlib.rcParams['axes.titlepad'] / 72. * fig.dpi) 

5442 

5443 

5444def test_title_location_roundtrip(): 

5445 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5446 # set default title location 

5447 plt.rcParams['axes.titlelocation'] = 'center' 

5448 ax.set_title('aardvark') 

5449 ax.set_title('left', loc='left') 

5450 ax.set_title('right', loc='right') 

5451 

5452 assert 'left' == ax.get_title(loc='left') 

5453 assert 'right' == ax.get_title(loc='right') 

5454 assert 'aardvark' == ax.get_title(loc='center') 

5455 

5456 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5457 ax.get_title(loc='foo') 

5458 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

5459 ax.set_title('fail', loc='foo') 

5460 

5461 

5462@image_comparison(["loglog.png"], remove_text=True, tol=0.02) 

5463def test_loglog(): 

5464 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5465 x = np.arange(1, 11) 

5466 ax.loglog(x, x**3, lw=5) 

5467 ax.tick_params(length=25, width=2) 

5468 ax.tick_params(length=15, width=2, which='minor') 

5469 

5470 

5471@pytest.mark.parametrize("new_api", [False, True]) 

5472@image_comparison(["test_loglog_nonpos.png"], remove_text=True, style='mpl20') 

5473def test_loglog_nonpos(new_api): 

5474 fig, axs = plt.subplots(3, 3) 

5475 x = np.arange(1, 11) 

5476 y = x**3 

5477 y[7] = -3. 

5478 x[4] = -10 

5479 for (i, j), ax in np.ndenumerate(axs): 

5480 mcx = ['mask', 'clip', ''][j] 

5481 mcy = ['mask', 'clip', ''][i] 

5482 if new_api: 

5483 if mcx == mcy: 

5484 if mcx: 

5485 ax.loglog(x, y**3, lw=2, nonpositive=mcx) 

5486 else: 

5487 ax.loglog(x, y**3, lw=2) 

5488 else: 

5489 ax.loglog(x, y**3, lw=2) 

5490 if mcx: 

5491 ax.set_xscale("log", nonpositive=mcx) 

5492 if mcy: 

5493 ax.set_yscale("log", nonpositive=mcy) 

5494 else: 

5495 kws = {} 

5496 if mcx: 

5497 kws['nonposx'] = mcx 

5498 if mcy: 

5499 kws['nonposy'] = mcy 

5500 with (pytest.warns(MatplotlibDeprecationWarning) if kws 

5501 else nullcontext()): 

5502 ax.loglog(x, y**3, lw=2, **kws) 

5503 

5504 

5505@pytest.mark.style('default') 

5506def test_axes_margins(): 

5507 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5508 ax.plot([0, 1, 2, 3]) 

5509 assert ax.get_ybound()[0] != 0 

5510 

5511 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5512 ax.bar([0, 1, 2, 3], [1, 1, 1, 1]) 

5513 assert ax.get_ybound()[0] == 0 

5514 

5515 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5516 ax.barh([0, 1, 2, 3], [1, 1, 1, 1]) 

5517 assert ax.get_xbound()[0] == 0 

5518 

5519 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5520 ax.pcolor(np.zeros((10, 10))) 

5521 assert ax.get_xbound() == (0, 10) 

5522 assert ax.get_ybound() == (0, 10) 

5523 

5524 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5525 ax.pcolorfast(np.zeros((10, 10))) 

5526 assert ax.get_xbound() == (0, 10) 

5527 assert ax.get_ybound() == (0, 10) 

5528 

5529 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5530 ax.hist(np.arange(10)) 

5531 assert ax.get_ybound()[0] == 0 

5532 

5533 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5534 ax.imshow(np.zeros((10, 10))) 

5535 assert ax.get_xbound() == (-0.5, 9.5) 

5536 assert ax.get_ybound() == (-0.5, 9.5) 

5537 

5538 

5539@pytest.fixture(params=['x', 'y']) 

5540def shared_axis_remover(request): 

5541 def _helper_x(ax): 

5542 ax2 = ax.twinx() 

5543 ax2.remove() 

5544 ax.set_xlim(0, 15) 

5545 r = ax.xaxis.get_major_locator()() 

5546 assert r[-1] > 14 

5547 

5548 def _helper_y(ax): 

5549 ax2 = ax.twiny() 

5550 ax2.remove() 

5551 ax.set_ylim(0, 15) 

5552 r = ax.yaxis.get_major_locator()() 

5553 assert r[-1] > 14 

5554 

5555 return {"x": _helper_x, "y": _helper_y}[request.param] 

5556 

5557 

5558@pytest.fixture(params=['gca', 'subplots', 'subplots_shared', 'add_axes']) 

5559def shared_axes_generator(request): 

5560 # test all of the ways to get fig/ax sets 

5561 if request.param == 'gca': 

5562 fig = plt.figure() 

5563 ax = fig.gca() 

5564 elif request.param == 'subplots': 

5565 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5566 elif request.param == 'subplots_shared': 

5567 fig, ax_lst = plt.subplots(2, 2, sharex='all', sharey='all') 

5568 ax = ax_lst[0][0] 

5569 elif request.param == 'add_axes': 5569 ↛ 5572line 5569 didn't jump to line 5572, because the condition on line 5569 was never false

5570 fig = plt.figure() 

5571 ax = fig.add_axes([.1, .1, .8, .8]) 

5572 return fig, ax 

5573 

5574 

5575def test_remove_shared_axes(shared_axes_generator, shared_axis_remover): 

5576 # test all of the ways to get fig/ax sets 

5577 fig, ax = shared_axes_generator 

5578 shared_axis_remover(ax) 

5579 

5580 

5581def test_remove_shared_axes_relim(): 

5582 fig, ax_lst = plt.subplots(2, 2, sharex='all', sharey='all') 

5583 ax = ax_lst[0][0] 

5584 orig_xlim = ax_lst[0][1].get_xlim() 

5585 ax.remove() 

5586 ax.set_xlim(0, 5) 

5587 assert_array_equal(ax_lst[0][1].get_xlim(), orig_xlim) 

5588 

5589 

5590def test_shared_axes_autoscale(): 

5591 l = np.arange(-80, 90, 40) 

5592 t = np.random.random_sample((l.size, l.size)) 

5593 

5594 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(2, 1, sharex=True, sharey=True) 

5595 

5596 ax1.set_xlim(-1000, 1000) 

5597 ax1.set_ylim(-1000, 1000) 

5598 ax1.contour(l, l, t) 

5599 

5600 ax2.contour(l, l, t) 

5601 assert not ax1.get_autoscalex_on() and not ax2.get_autoscalex_on() 

5602 assert not ax1.get_autoscaley_on() and not ax2.get_autoscaley_on() 

5603 assert ax1.get_xlim() == ax2.get_xlim() == (-1000, 1000) 

5604 assert ax1.get_ylim() == ax2.get_ylim() == (-1000, 1000) 

5605 

5606 

5607def test_adjust_numtick_aspect(): 

5608 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5609 ax.yaxis.get_major_locator().set_params(nbins='auto') 

5610 ax.set_xlim(0, 1000) 

5611 ax.set_aspect('equal') 

5612 fig.canvas.draw() 

5613 assert len(ax.yaxis.get_major_locator()()) == 2 

5614 ax.set_ylim(0, 1000) 

5615 fig.canvas.draw() 

5616 assert len(ax.yaxis.get_major_locator()()) > 2 

5617 

5618 

5619@image_comparison(["auto_numticks.png"], style='default') 

5620def test_auto_numticks(): 

5621 # Make tiny, empty subplots, verify that there are only 3 ticks. 

5622 plt.subplots(4, 4) 

5623 

5624 

5625@image_comparison(["auto_numticks_log.png"], style='default') 

5626def test_auto_numticks_log(): 

5627 # Verify that there are not too many ticks with a large log range. 

5628 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5629 matplotlib.rcParams['axes.autolimit_mode'] = 'round_numbers' 

5630 ax.loglog([1e-20, 1e5], [1e-16, 10]) 

5631 

5632 

5633def test_broken_barh_empty(): 

5634 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5635 ax.broken_barh([], (.1, .5)) 

5636 

5637 

5638def test_broken_barh_timedelta(): 

5639 """Check that timedelta works as x, dx pair for this method.""" 

5640 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5641 d0 = datetime.datetime(2018, 11, 9, 0, 0, 0) 

5642 pp = ax.broken_barh([(d0, datetime.timedelta(hours=1))], [1, 2]) 

5643 assert pp.get_paths()[0].vertices[0, 0] == mdates.date2num(d0) 

5644 assert pp.get_paths()[0].vertices[2, 0] == mdates.date2num(d0) + 1 / 24 

5645 

5646 

5647def test_pandas_pcolormesh(pd): 

5648 time = pd.date_range('2000-01-01', periods=10) 

5649 depth = np.arange(20) 

5650 data = np.random.rand(19, 9) 

5651 

5652 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5653 ax.pcolormesh(time, depth, data) 

5654 

5655 

5656def test_pandas_indexing_dates(pd): 

5657 dates = np.arange('2005-02', '2005-03', dtype='datetime64[D]') 

5658 values = np.sin(np.array(range(len(dates)))) 

5659 df = pd.DataFrame({'dates': dates, 'values': values}) 

5660 

5661 ax = plt.gca() 

5662 

5663 without_zero_index = df[np.array(df.index) % 2 == 1].copy() 

5664 ax.plot('dates', 'values', data=without_zero_index) 

5665 

5666 

5667def test_pandas_errorbar_indexing(pd): 

5668 df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.uniform(size=(5, 4)), 

5669 columns=['x', 'y', 'xe', 'ye'], 

5670 index=[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) 

5671 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5672 ax.errorbar('x', 'y', xerr='xe', yerr='ye', data=df) 

5673 

5674 

5675def test_pandas_index_shape(pd): 

5676 df = pd.DataFrame({"XX": [4, 5, 6], "YY": [7, 1, 2]}) 

5677 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5678 ax.plot(df.index, df['YY']) 

5679 

5680 

5681def test_pandas_indexing_hist(pd): 

5682 ser_1 = pd.Series(data=[1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 4, 5]) 

5683 ser_2 = ser_1.iloc[1:] 

5684 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5685 ax.hist(ser_2) 

5686 

5687 

5688def test_pandas_bar_align_center(pd): 

5689 # Tests fix for issue 8767 

5690 df = pd.DataFrame({'a': range(2), 'b': range(2)}) 

5691 

5692 fig, ax = plt.subplots(1) 

5693 

5694 ax.bar(df.loc[df['a'] == 1, 'b'], 

5695 df.loc[df['a'] == 1, 'b'], 

5696 align='center') 

5697 

5698 fig.canvas.draw() 

5699 

5700 

5701def test_axis_set_tick_params_labelsize_labelcolor(): 

5702 # Tests fix for issue 4346 

5703 axis_1 = plt.subplot() 

5704 axis_1.yaxis.set_tick_params(labelsize=30, labelcolor='red', 

5705 direction='out') 

5706 

5707 # Expected values after setting the ticks 

5708 assert axis_1.yaxis.majorTicks[0]._size == 4.0 

5709 assert axis_1.yaxis.majorTicks[0].tick1line.get_color() == 'k' 

5710 assert axis_1.yaxis.majorTicks[0].label1.get_size() == 30.0 

5711 assert axis_1.yaxis.majorTicks[0].label1.get_color() == 'red' 

5712 

5713 

5714def test_axes_tick_params_gridlines(): 

5715 # Now treating grid params like other Tick params 

5716 ax = plt.subplot() 

5717 ax.tick_params(grid_color='b', grid_linewidth=5, grid_alpha=0.5, 

5718 grid_linestyle='dashdot') 

5719 for axis in ax.xaxis, ax.yaxis: 

5720 assert axis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_color() == 'b' 

5721 assert axis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_linewidth() == 5 

5722 assert axis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_alpha() == 0.5 

5723 assert axis.majorTicks[0].gridline.get_linestyle() == '-.' 

5724 

5725 

5726def test_axes_tick_params_ylabelside(): 

5727 # Tests fix for issue 10267 

5728 ax = plt.subplot() 

5729 ax.tick_params(labelleft=False, labelright=True, 

5730 which='major') 

5731 ax.tick_params(labelleft=False, labelright=True, 

5732 which='minor') 

5733 # expects left false, right true 

5734 assert ax.yaxis.majorTicks[0].label1.get_visible() is False 

5735 assert ax.yaxis.majorTicks[0].label2.get_visible() is True 

5736 assert ax.yaxis.minorTicks[0].label1.get_visible() is False 

5737 assert ax.yaxis.minorTicks[0].label2.get_visible() is True 

5738 

5739 

5740def test_axes_tick_params_xlabelside(): 

5741 # Tests fix for issue 10267 

5742 ax = plt.subplot() 

5743 ax.tick_params(labeltop=True, labelbottom=False, 

5744 which='major') 

5745 ax.tick_params(labeltop=True, labelbottom=False, 

5746 which='minor') 

5747 # expects top True, bottom False 

5748 # label1.get_visible() mapped to labelbottom 

5749 # label2.get_visible() mapped to labeltop 

5750 assert ax.xaxis.majorTicks[0].label1.get_visible() is False 

5751 assert ax.xaxis.majorTicks[0].label2.get_visible() is True 

5752 assert ax.xaxis.minorTicks[0].label1.get_visible() is False 

5753 assert ax.xaxis.minorTicks[0].label2.get_visible() is True 

5754 

5755 

5756def test_none_kwargs(): 

5757 ax = plt.figure().subplots() 

5758 ln, = ax.plot(range(32), linestyle=None) 

5759 assert ln.get_linestyle() == '-' 

5760 

5761 

5762def test_bar_uint8(): 

5763 xs = [0, 1, 2, 3] 

5764 b = plt.bar(np.array(xs, dtype=np.uint8), [2, 3, 4, 5], align="edge") 

5765 for (patch, x) in zip(b.patches, xs): 

5766 assert patch.xy[0] == x 

5767 

5768 

5769@image_comparison(['date_timezone_x.png'], tol=1.0) 

5770def test_date_timezone_x(): 

5771 # Tests issue 5575 

5772 time_index = [datetime.datetime(2016, 2, 22, hour=x, 

5773 tzinfo=dateutil.tz.gettz('Canada/Eastern')) 

5774 for x in range(3)] 

5775 

5776 # Same Timezone 

5777 plt.figure(figsize=(20, 12)) 

5778 plt.subplot(2, 1, 1) 

5779 plt.plot_date(time_index, [3] * 3, tz='Canada/Eastern') 

5780 

5781 # Different Timezone 

5782 plt.subplot(2, 1, 2) 

5783 plt.plot_date(time_index, [3] * 3, tz='UTC') 

5784 

5785 

5786@image_comparison(['date_timezone_y.png']) 

5787def test_date_timezone_y(): 

5788 # Tests issue 5575 

5789 time_index = [datetime.datetime(2016, 2, 22, hour=x, 

5790 tzinfo=dateutil.tz.gettz('Canada/Eastern')) 

5791 for x in range(3)] 

5792 

5793 # Same Timezone 

5794 plt.figure(figsize=(20, 12)) 

5795 plt.subplot(2, 1, 1) 

5796 plt.plot_date([3] * 3, 

5797 time_index, tz='Canada/Eastern', xdate=False, ydate=True) 

5798 

5799 # Different Timezone 

5800 plt.subplot(2, 1, 2) 

5801 plt.plot_date([3] * 3, time_index, tz='UTC', xdate=False, ydate=True) 

5802 

5803 

5804@image_comparison(['date_timezone_x_and_y.png'], tol=1.0) 

5805def test_date_timezone_x_and_y(): 

5806 # Tests issue 5575 

5807 UTC = datetime.timezone.utc 

5808 time_index = [datetime.datetime(2016, 2, 22, hour=x, tzinfo=UTC) 

5809 for x in range(3)] 

5810 

5811 # Same Timezone 

5812 plt.figure(figsize=(20, 12)) 

5813 plt.subplot(2, 1, 1) 

5814 plt.plot_date(time_index, time_index, tz='UTC', ydate=True) 

5815 

5816 # Different Timezone 

5817 plt.subplot(2, 1, 2) 

5818 plt.plot_date(time_index, time_index, tz='US/Eastern', ydate=True) 

5819 

5820 

5821@image_comparison(['axisbelow.png'], remove_text=True) 

5822def test_axisbelow(): 

5823 # Test 'line' setting added in 6287. 

5824 # Show only grids, not frame or ticks, to make this test 

5825 # independent of future change to drawing order of those elements. 

5826 axs = plt.figure().subplots(ncols=3, sharex=True, sharey=True) 

5827 settings = (False, 'line', True) 

5828 

5829 for ax, setting in zip(axs, settings): 

5830 ax.plot((0, 10), (0, 10), lw=10, color='m') 

5831 circ = mpatches.Circle((3, 3), color='r') 

5832 ax.add_patch(circ) 

5833 ax.grid(color='c', linestyle='-', linewidth=3) 

5834 ax.tick_params(top=False, bottom=False, 

5835 left=False, right=False) 

5836 ax.spines[:].set_visible(False) 

5837 ax.set_axisbelow(setting) 

5838 

5839 

5840def test_titletwiny(): 

5841 plt.style.use('mpl20') 

5842 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=72) 

5843 ax2 = ax.twiny() 

5844 xlabel2 = ax2.set_xlabel('Xlabel2') 

5845 title = ax.set_title('Title') 

5846 fig.canvas.draw() 

5847 renderer = fig.canvas.get_renderer() 

5848 # ------- Test that title is put above Xlabel2 (Xlabel2 at top) ---------- 

5849 bbox_y0_title = title.get_window_extent(renderer).y0 # bottom of title 

5850 bbox_y1_xlabel2 = xlabel2.get_window_extent(renderer).y1 # top of xlabel2 

5851 y_diff = bbox_y0_title - bbox_y1_xlabel2 

5852 assert np.isclose(y_diff, 3) 

5853 

5854 

5855def test_titlesetpos(): 

5856 # Test that title stays put if we set it manually 

5857 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5858 fig.subplots_adjust(top=0.8) 

5859 ax2 = ax.twiny() 

5860 ax.set_xlabel('Xlabel') 

5861 ax2.set_xlabel('Xlabel2') 

5862 ax.set_title('Title') 

5863 pos = (0.5, 1.11) 

5864 ax.title.set_position(pos) 

5865 renderer = fig.canvas.get_renderer() 

5866 ax._update_title_position(renderer) 

5867 assert ax.title.get_position() == pos 

5868 

5869 

5870def test_title_xticks_top(): 

5871 # Test that title moves if xticks on top of axes. 

5872 mpl.rcParams['axes.titley'] = None 

5873 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5874 ax.xaxis.set_ticks_position('top') 

5875 ax.set_title('xlabel top') 

5876 fig.canvas.draw() 

5877 assert ax.title.get_position()[1] > 1.04 

5878 

5879 

5880def test_title_xticks_top_both(): 

5881 # Test that title moves if xticks on top of axes. 

5882 mpl.rcParams['axes.titley'] = None 

5883 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5884 ax.tick_params(axis="x", 

5885 bottom=True, top=True, labelbottom=True, labeltop=True) 

5886 ax.set_title('xlabel top') 

5887 fig.canvas.draw() 

5888 assert ax.title.get_position()[1] > 1.04 

5889 

5890 

5891def test_title_no_move_off_page(): 

5892 # If an axes is off the figure (ie. if it is cropped during a save) 

5893 # make sure that the automatic title repositioning does not get done. 

5894 mpl.rcParams['axes.titley'] = None 

5895 fig = plt.figure() 

5896 ax = fig.add_axes([0.1, -0.5, 0.8, 0.2]) 

5897 ax.tick_params(axis="x", 

5898 bottom=True, top=True, labelbottom=True, labeltop=True) 

5899 tt = ax.set_title('Boo') 

5900 fig.canvas.draw() 

5901 assert tt.get_position()[1] == 1.0 

5902 

5903 

5904def test_offset_label_color(): 

5905 # Tests issue 6440 

5906 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5907 ax.plot([1.01e9, 1.02e9, 1.03e9]) 

5908 ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(labelcolor='red') 

5909 assert ax.yaxis.get_offset_text().get_color() == 'red' 

5910 

5911 

5912def test_offset_text_visible(): 

5913 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5914 ax.plot([1.01e9, 1.02e9, 1.03e9]) 

5915 ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(label1On=False, label2On=True) 

5916 assert ax.yaxis.get_offset_text().get_visible() 

5917 ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(label2On=False) 

5918 assert not ax.yaxis.get_offset_text().get_visible() 

5919 

5920 

5921def test_large_offset(): 

5922 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5923 ax.plot((1 + np.array([0, 1.e-12])) * 1.e27) 

5924 fig.canvas.draw() 

5925 

5926 

5927def test_barb_units(): 

5928 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5929 dates = [datetime.datetime(2017, 7, 15, 18, i) for i in range(0, 60, 10)] 

5930 y = np.linspace(0, 5, len(dates)) 

5931 u = v = np.linspace(0, 50, len(dates)) 

5932 ax.barbs(dates, y, u, v) 

5933 

5934 

5935def test_quiver_units(): 

5936 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5937 dates = [datetime.datetime(2017, 7, 15, 18, i) for i in range(0, 60, 10)] 

5938 y = np.linspace(0, 5, len(dates)) 

5939 u = v = np.linspace(0, 50, len(dates)) 

5940 ax.quiver(dates, y, u, v) 

5941 

5942 

5943def test_bar_color_cycle(): 

5944 to_rgb = mcolors.to_rgb 

5945 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5946 for j in range(5): 

5947 ln, = ax.plot(range(3)) 

5948 brs = ax.bar(range(3), range(3)) 

5949 for br in brs: 

5950 assert to_rgb(ln.get_color()) == to_rgb(br.get_facecolor()) 

5951 

5952 

5953def test_tick_param_label_rotation(): 

5954 fix, (ax, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2) 

5955 ax.plot([0, 1], [0, 1]) 

5956 ax2.plot([0, 1], [0, 1]) 

5957 ax.xaxis.set_tick_params(which='both', rotation=75) 

5958 ax.yaxis.set_tick_params(which='both', rotation=90) 

5959 for text in ax.get_xticklabels(which='both'): 

5960 assert text.get_rotation() == 75 

5961 for text in ax.get_yticklabels(which='both'): 

5962 assert text.get_rotation() == 90 

5963 

5964 ax2.tick_params(axis='x', labelrotation=53) 

5965 ax2.tick_params(axis='y', rotation=35) 

5966 for text in ax2.get_xticklabels(which='major'): 

5967 assert text.get_rotation() == 53 

5968 for text in ax2.get_yticklabels(which='major'): 

5969 assert text.get_rotation() == 35 

5970 

5971 

5972@pytest.mark.style('default') 

5973def test_fillbetween_cycle(): 

5974 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

5975 

5976 for j in range(3): 

5977 cc = ax.fill_between(range(3), range(3)) 

5978 target = mcolors.to_rgba('C{}'.format(j)) 

5979 assert tuple(cc.get_facecolors().squeeze()) == tuple(target) 

5980 

5981 for j in range(3, 6): 

5982 cc = ax.fill_betweenx(range(3), range(3)) 

5983 target = mcolors.to_rgba('C{}'.format(j)) 

5984 assert tuple(cc.get_facecolors().squeeze()) == tuple(target) 

5985 

5986 target = mcolors.to_rgba('k') 

5987 

5988 for al in ['facecolor', 'facecolors', 'color']: 

5989 cc = ax.fill_between(range(3), range(3), **{al: 'k'}) 

5990 assert tuple(cc.get_facecolors().squeeze()) == tuple(target) 

5991 

5992 edge_target = mcolors.to_rgba('k') 

5993 for j, el in enumerate(['edgecolor', 'edgecolors'], start=6): 

5994 cc = ax.fill_between(range(3), range(3), **{el: 'k'}) 

5995 face_target = mcolors.to_rgba('C{}'.format(j)) 

5996 assert tuple(cc.get_facecolors().squeeze()) == tuple(face_target) 

5997 assert tuple(cc.get_edgecolors().squeeze()) == tuple(edge_target) 

5998 

5999 

6000def test_log_margins(): 

6001 plt.rcParams['axes.autolimit_mode'] = 'data' 

6002 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6003 margin = 0.05 

6004 ax.set_xmargin(margin) 

6005 ax.semilogx([10, 100], [10, 100]) 

6006 xlim0, xlim1 = ax.get_xlim() 

6007 transform = ax.xaxis.get_transform() 

6008 xlim0t, xlim1t = transform.transform([xlim0, xlim1]) 

6009 x0t, x1t = transform.transform([10, 100]) 

6010 delta = (x1t - x0t) * margin 

6011 assert_allclose([xlim0t + delta, xlim1t - delta], [x0t, x1t]) 

6012 

6013 

6014def test_color_length_mismatch(): 

6015 N = 5 

6016 x, y = np.arange(N), np.arange(N) 

6017 colors = np.arange(N+1) 

6018 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6019 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6020 ax.scatter(x, y, c=colors) 

6021 c_rgb = (0.5, 0.5, 0.5) 

6022 ax.scatter(x, y, c=c_rgb) 

6023 ax.scatter(x, y, c=[c_rgb] * N) 

6024 

6025 

6026def test_eventplot_legend(): 

6027 plt.eventplot([1.0], label='Label') 

6028 plt.legend() 

6029 

6030 

6031def test_bar_broadcast_args(): 

6032 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6033 # Check that a bar chart with a single height for all bars works. 

6034 ax.bar(range(4), 1) 

6035 # Check that a horizontal chart with one width works. 

6036 ax.barh(0, 1, left=range(4), height=1) 

6037 # Check that edgecolor gets broadcast. 

6038 rect1, rect2 = ax.bar([0, 1], [0, 1], edgecolor=(.1, .2, .3, .4)) 

6039 assert rect1.get_edgecolor() == rect2.get_edgecolor() == (.1, .2, .3, .4) 

6040 

6041 

6042def test_invalid_axis_limits(): 

6043 plt.plot([0, 1], [0, 1]) 

6044 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6045 plt.xlim(np.nan) 

6046 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6047 plt.xlim(np.inf) 

6048 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6049 plt.ylim(np.nan) 

6050 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6051 plt.ylim(np.inf) 

6052 

6053 

6054# Test all 4 combinations of logs/symlogs for minorticks_on() 

6055@pytest.mark.parametrize('xscale', ['symlog', 'log']) 

6056@pytest.mark.parametrize('yscale', ['symlog', 'log']) 

6057def test_minorticks_on(xscale, yscale): 

6058 ax = plt.subplot() 

6059 ax.plot([1, 2, 3, 4]) 

6060 ax.set_xscale(xscale) 

6061 ax.set_yscale(yscale) 

6062 ax.minorticks_on() 

6063 

6064 

6065def test_twinx_knows_limits(): 

6066 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6067 

6068 ax.axvspan(1, 2) 

6069 xtwin = ax.twinx() 

6070 xtwin.plot([0, 0.5], [1, 2]) 

6071 # control axis 

6072 fig2, ax2 = plt.subplots() 

6073 

6074 ax2.axvspan(1, 2) 

6075 ax2.plot([0, 0.5], [1, 2]) 

6076 

6077 assert_array_equal(xtwin.viewLim.intervalx, ax2.viewLim.intervalx) 

6078 

6079 

6080def test_zero_linewidth(): 

6081 # Check that setting a zero linewidth doesn't error 

6082 plt.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], ls='--', lw=0) 

6083 

6084 

6085def test_empty_errorbar_legend(): 

6086 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6087 ax.errorbar([], [], xerr=[], label='empty y') 

6088 ax.errorbar([], [], yerr=[], label='empty x') 

6089 ax.legend() 

6090 

6091 

6092@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

6093def test_plot_decimal(fig_test, fig_ref): 

6094 x0 = np.arange(-10, 10, 0.3) 

6095 y0 = [5.2 * x ** 3 - 2.1 * x ** 2 + 7.34 * x + 4.5 for x in x0] 

6096 x = [Decimal(i) for i in x0] 

6097 y = [Decimal(i) for i in y0] 

6098 # Test image - line plot with Decimal input 

6099 fig_test.subplots().plot(x, y) 

6100 # Reference image 

6101 fig_ref.subplots().plot(x0, y0) 

6102 

6103 

6104# pdf and svg tests fail using travis' old versions of gs and inkscape. 

6105@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

6106def test_markerfacecolor_none_alpha(fig_test, fig_ref): 

6107 fig_test.subplots().plot(0, "o", mfc="none", alpha=.5) 

6108 fig_ref.subplots().plot(0, "o", mfc="w", alpha=.5) 

6109 

6110 

6111def test_tick_padding_tightbbox(): 

6112 """Test that tick padding gets turned off if axis is off""" 

6113 plt.rcParams["xtick.direction"] = "out" 

6114 plt.rcParams["ytick.direction"] = "out" 

6115 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6116 bb = ax.get_tightbbox(fig.canvas.get_renderer()) 

6117 ax.axis('off') 

6118 bb2 = ax.get_tightbbox(fig.canvas.get_renderer()) 

6119 assert bb.x0 < bb2.x0 

6120 assert bb.y0 < bb2.y0 

6121 

6122 

6123def test_inset(): 

6124 """ 

6125 Ensure that inset_ax argument is indeed optional 

6126 """ 

6127 dx, dy = 0.05, 0.05 

6128 # generate 2 2d grids for the x & y bounds 

6129 y, x = np.mgrid[slice(1, 5 + dy, dy), 

6130 slice(1, 5 + dx, dx)] 

6131 z = np.sin(x) ** 10 + np.cos(10 + y * x) * np.cos(x) 

6132 

6133 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6134 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, z[:-1, :-1]) 

6135 ax.set_aspect(1.) 

6136 ax.apply_aspect() 

6137 # we need to apply_aspect to make the drawing below work. 

6138 

6139 xlim = [1.5, 2.15] 

6140 ylim = [2, 2.5] 

6141 

6142 rect = [xlim[0], ylim[0], xlim[1] - xlim[0], ylim[1] - ylim[0]] 

6143 

6144 rec, connectors = ax.indicate_inset(bounds=rect) 

6145 assert connectors is None 

6146 fig.canvas.draw() 

6147 xx = np.array([[1.5, 2.], 

6148 [2.15, 2.5]]) 

6149 assert np.all(rec.get_bbox().get_points() == xx) 

6150 

6151 

6152def test_zoom_inset(): 

6153 dx, dy = 0.05, 0.05 

6154 # generate 2 2d grids for the x & y bounds 

6155 y, x = np.mgrid[slice(1, 5 + dy, dy), 

6156 slice(1, 5 + dx, dx)] 

6157 z = np.sin(x)**10 + np.cos(10 + y*x) * np.cos(x) 

6158 

6159 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6160 ax.pcolormesh(x, y, z[:-1, :-1]) 

6161 ax.set_aspect(1.) 

6162 ax.apply_aspect() 

6163 # we need to apply_aspect to make the drawing below work. 

6164 

6165 # Make the inset_axes... Position axes coordinates... 

6166 axin1 = ax.inset_axes([0.7, 0.7, 0.35, 0.35]) 

6167 # redraw the data in the inset axes... 

6168 axin1.pcolormesh(x, y, z[:-1, :-1]) 

6169 axin1.set_xlim([1.5, 2.15]) 

6170 axin1.set_ylim([2, 2.5]) 

6171 axin1.set_aspect(ax.get_aspect()) 

6172 

6173 rec, connectors = ax.indicate_inset_zoom(axin1) 

6174 assert len(connectors) == 4 

6175 fig.canvas.draw() 

6176 xx = np.array([[1.5, 2.], 

6177 [2.15, 2.5]]) 

6178 assert(np.all(rec.get_bbox().get_points() == xx)) 

6179 xx = np.array([[0.6325, 0.692308], 

6180 [0.8425, 0.907692]]) 

6181 np.testing.assert_allclose( 

6182 axin1.get_position().get_points(), xx, rtol=1e-4) 

6183 

6184 

6185@pytest.mark.parametrize('x_inverted', [False, True]) 

6186@pytest.mark.parametrize('y_inverted', [False, True]) 

6187def test_indicate_inset_inverted(x_inverted, y_inverted): 

6188 """ 

6189 Test that the inset lines are correctly located with inverted data axes. 

6190 """ 

6191 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(1, 2) 

6192 

6193 x = np.arange(10) 

6194 ax1.plot(x, x, 'o') 

6195 if x_inverted: 

6196 ax1.invert_xaxis() 

6197 if y_inverted: 

6198 ax1.invert_yaxis() 

6199 

6200 rect, bounds = ax1.indicate_inset([2, 2, 5, 4], ax2) 

6201 lower_left, upper_left, lower_right, upper_right = bounds 

6202 

6203 sign_x = -1 if x_inverted else 1 

6204 sign_y = -1 if y_inverted else 1 

6205 assert sign_x * (lower_right.xy2[0] - lower_left.xy2[0]) > 0 

6206 assert sign_x * (upper_right.xy2[0] - upper_left.xy2[0]) > 0 

6207 assert sign_y * (upper_left.xy2[1] - lower_left.xy2[1]) > 0 

6208 assert sign_y * (upper_right.xy2[1] - lower_right.xy2[1]) > 0 

6209 

6210 

6211def test_set_position(): 

6212 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6213 ax.set_aspect(3.) 

6214 ax.set_position([0.1, 0.1, 0.4, 0.4], which='both') 

6215 assert np.allclose(ax.get_position().width, 0.1) 

6216 ax.set_aspect(2.) 

6217 ax.set_position([0.1, 0.1, 0.4, 0.4], which='original') 

6218 assert np.allclose(ax.get_position().width, 0.15) 

6219 ax.set_aspect(3.) 

6220 ax.set_position([0.1, 0.1, 0.4, 0.4], which='active') 

6221 assert np.allclose(ax.get_position().width, 0.1) 

6222 

6223 

6224def test_spines_properbbox_after_zoom(): 

6225 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6226 bb = ax.spines.bottom.get_window_extent(fig.canvas.get_renderer()) 

6227 # this is what zoom calls: 

6228 ax._set_view_from_bbox((320, 320, 500, 500), 'in', 

6229 None, False, False) 

6230 bb2 = ax.spines.bottom.get_window_extent(fig.canvas.get_renderer()) 

6231 np.testing.assert_allclose(bb.get_points(), bb2.get_points(), rtol=1e-6) 

6232 

6233 

6234def test_cartopy_backcompat(): 

6235 

6236 class Dummy(matplotlib.axes.Axes): 

6237 ... 

6238 

6239 class DummySubplot(matplotlib.axes.SubplotBase, Dummy): 

6240 _axes_class = Dummy 

6241 

6242 matplotlib.axes._subplots._subplot_classes[Dummy] = DummySubplot 

6243 

6244 FactoryDummySubplot = matplotlib.axes.subplot_class_factory(Dummy) 

6245 

6246 assert DummySubplot is FactoryDummySubplot 

6247 

6248 

6249def test_gettightbbox_ignore_nan(): 

6250 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6251 remove_ticks_and_titles(fig) 

6252 ax.text(np.NaN, 1, 'Boo') 

6253 renderer = fig.canvas.get_renderer() 

6254 np.testing.assert_allclose(ax.get_tightbbox(renderer).width, 496) 

6255 

6256 

6257def test_scatter_series_non_zero_index(pd): 

6258 # create non-zero index 

6259 ids = range(10, 18) 

6260 x = pd.Series(np.random.uniform(size=8), index=ids) 

6261 y = pd.Series(np.random.uniform(size=8), index=ids) 

6262 c = pd.Series([1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0], index=ids) 

6263 plt.scatter(x, y, c) 

6264 

6265 

6266def test_scatter_empty_data(): 

6267 # making sure this does not raise an exception 

6268 plt.scatter([], []) 

6269 plt.scatter([], [], s=[], c=[]) 

6270 

6271 

6272@image_comparison(['annotate_across_transforms.png'], 

6273 style='mpl20', remove_text=True) 

6274def test_annotate_across_transforms(): 

6275 x = np.linspace(0, 10, 200) 

6276 y = np.exp(-x) * np.sin(x) 

6277 

6278 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(3.39, 3)) 

6279 ax.plot(x, y) 

6280 axins = ax.inset_axes([0.4, 0.5, 0.3, 0.3]) 

6281 axins.set_aspect(0.2) 

6282 axins.xaxis.set_visible(False) 

6283 axins.yaxis.set_visible(False) 

6284 ax.annotate("", xy=(x[150], y[150]), xycoords=ax.transData, 

6285 xytext=(1, 0), textcoords=axins.transAxes, 

6286 arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->")) 

6287 

6288 

6289@image_comparison(['secondary_xy.png'], style='mpl20') 

6290def test_secondary_xy(): 

6291 fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(10, 5), constrained_layout=True) 

6292 

6293 def invert(x): 

6294 with np.errstate(divide='ignore'): 

6295 return 1 / x 

6296 

6297 for nn, ax in enumerate(axs): 

6298 ax.plot(np.arange(2, 11), np.arange(2, 11)) 

6299 if nn == 0: 

6300 secax = ax.secondary_xaxis 

6301 else: 

6302 secax = ax.secondary_yaxis 

6303 

6304 secax(0.2, functions=(invert, invert)) 

6305 secax(0.4, functions=(lambda x: 2 * x, lambda x: x / 2)) 

6306 secax(0.6, functions=(lambda x: x**2, lambda x: x**(1/2))) 

6307 secax(0.8) 

6308 

6309 

6310def test_secondary_fail(): 

6311 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6312 ax.plot(np.arange(2, 11), np.arange(2, 11)) 

6313 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6314 ax.secondary_xaxis(0.2, functions=(lambda x: 1 / x)) 6314 ↛ exitline 6314 didn't run the lambda on line 6314

6315 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6316 ax.secondary_xaxis('right') 

6317 with pytest.raises(ValueError): 

6318 ax.secondary_yaxis('bottom') 

6319 

6320 

6321def test_secondary_resize(): 

6322 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5)) 

6323 ax.plot(np.arange(2, 11), np.arange(2, 11)) 

6324 

6325 def invert(x): 

6326 with np.errstate(divide='ignore'): 

6327 return 1 / x 

6328 

6329 ax.secondary_xaxis('top', functions=(invert, invert)) 

6330 fig.canvas.draw() 

6331 fig.set_size_inches((7, 4)) 

6332 assert_allclose(ax.get_position().extents, [0.125, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9]) 

6333 

6334 

6335def test_secondary_minorloc(): 

6336 fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5)) 

6337 ax.plot(np.arange(2, 11), np.arange(2, 11)) 

6338 

6339 def invert(x): 

6340 with np.errstate(divide='ignore'): 

6341 return 1 / x 

6342 

6343 secax = ax.secondary_xaxis('top', functions=(invert, invert)) 

6344 assert isinstance(secax._axis.get_minor_locator(), 

6345 mticker.NullLocator) 

6346 secax.minorticks_on() 

6347 assert isinstance(secax._axis.get_minor_locator(), 

6348 mticker.AutoMinorLocator) 

6349 ax.set_xscale('log') 

6350 plt.draw() 

6351 assert isinstance(secax._axis.get_minor_locator(), 

6352 mticker.LogLocator) 

6353 ax.set_xscale('linear') 

6354 plt.draw() 

6355 assert isinstance(secax._axis.get_minor_locator(), 

6356 mticker.NullLocator) 

6357 

6358 

6359def test_secondary_formatter(): 

6360 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6361 ax.set_xscale("log") 

6362 secax = ax.secondary_xaxis("top") 

6363 secax.xaxis.set_major_formatter(mticker.ScalarFormatter()) 

6364 fig.canvas.draw() 

6365 assert isinstance( 

6366 secax.xaxis.get_major_formatter(), mticker.ScalarFormatter) 

6367 

6368 

6369def color_boxes(fig, axs): 

6370 """ 

6371 Helper for the tests below that test the extents of various axes elements 

6372 """ 

6373 fig.canvas.draw() 

6374 

6375 renderer = fig.canvas.get_renderer() 

6376 bbaxis = [] 

6377 for nn, axx in enumerate([axs.xaxis, axs.yaxis]): 

6378 bb = axx.get_tightbbox(renderer) 

6379 if bb: 

6380 axisr = plt.Rectangle( 

6381 (bb.x0, bb.y0), width=bb.width, height=bb.height, 

6382 linewidth=0.7, edgecolor='y', facecolor="none", transform=None, 

6383 zorder=3) 

6384 fig.add_artist(axisr) 

6385 bbaxis += [bb] 

6386 

6387 bbspines = [] 

6388 for nn, a in enumerate(['bottom', 'top', 'left', 'right']): 

6389 bb = axs.spines[a].get_window_extent(renderer) 

6390 spiner = plt.Rectangle( 

6391 (bb.x0, bb.y0), width=bb.width, height=bb.height, 

6392 linewidth=0.7, edgecolor="green", facecolor="none", transform=None, 

6393 zorder=3) 

6394 fig.add_artist(spiner) 

6395 bbspines += [bb] 

6396 

6397 bb = axs.get_window_extent() 

6398 rect2 = plt.Rectangle( 

6399 (bb.x0, bb.y0), width=bb.width, height=bb.height, 

6400 linewidth=1.5, edgecolor="magenta", facecolor="none", transform=None, 

6401 zorder=2) 

6402 fig.add_artist(rect2) 

6403 bbax = bb 

6404 

6405 bb2 = axs.get_tightbbox(renderer) 

6406 rect2 = plt.Rectangle( 

6407 (bb2.x0, bb2.y0), width=bb2.width, height=bb2.height, 

6408 linewidth=3, edgecolor="red", facecolor="none", transform=None, 

6409 zorder=1) 

6410 fig.add_artist(rect2) 

6411 bbtb = bb2 

6412 return bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb 

6413 

6414 

6415def test_normal_axes(): 

6416 with rc_context({'_internal.classic_mode': False}): 

6417 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=200, figsize=(6, 6)) 

6418 fig.canvas.draw() 

6419 plt.close(fig) 

6420 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6421 

6422 # test the axis bboxes 

6423 target = [ 

6424 [123.375, 75.88888888888886, 983.25, 33.0], 

6425 [85.51388888888889, 99.99999999999997, 53.375, 993.0] 

6426 ] 

6427 for nn, b in enumerate(bbaxis): 

6428 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target[nn]) 

6429 assert_array_almost_equal(b.bounds, targetbb.bounds, decimal=2) 

6430 

6431 target = [ 

6432 [150.0, 119.999, 930.0, 11.111], 

6433 [150.0, 1080.0, 930.0, 0.0], 

6434 [150.0, 119.9999, 11.111, 960.0], 

6435 [1068.8888, 119.9999, 11.111, 960.0] 

6436 ] 

6437 for nn, b in enumerate(bbspines): 

6438 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target[nn]) 

6439 assert_array_almost_equal(b.bounds, targetbb.bounds, decimal=2) 

6440 

6441 target = [150.0, 119.99999999999997, 930.0, 960.0] 

6442 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6443 assert_array_almost_equal(bbax.bounds, targetbb.bounds, decimal=2) 

6444 

6445 target = [85.5138, 75.88888, 1021.11, 1017.11] 

6446 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6447 assert_array_almost_equal(bbtb.bounds, targetbb.bounds, decimal=2) 

6448 

6449 # test that get_position roundtrips to get_window_extent 

6450 axbb = ax.get_position().transformed(fig.transFigure).bounds 

6451 assert_array_almost_equal(axbb, ax.get_window_extent().bounds, decimal=2) 

6452 

6453 

6454def test_nodecorator(): 

6455 with rc_context({'_internal.classic_mode': False}): 

6456 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=200, figsize=(6, 6)) 

6457 fig.canvas.draw() 

6458 ax.set(xticklabels=[], yticklabels=[]) 

6459 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6460 

6461 # test the axis bboxes 

6462 for nn, b in enumerate(bbaxis): 

6463 assert b is None 

6464 

6465 target = [ 

6466 [150.0, 119.999, 930.0, 11.111], 

6467 [150.0, 1080.0, 930.0, 0.0], 

6468 [150.0, 119.9999, 11.111, 960.0], 

6469 [1068.8888, 119.9999, 11.111, 960.0] 

6470 ] 

6471 for nn, b in enumerate(bbspines): 

6472 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target[nn]) 

6473 assert_allclose(b.bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6474 

6475 target = [150.0, 119.99999999999997, 930.0, 960.0] 

6476 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6477 assert_allclose(bbax.bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6478 

6479 target = [150., 120., 930., 960.] 

6480 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6481 assert_allclose(bbtb.bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6482 

6483 

6484def test_displaced_spine(): 

6485 with rc_context({'_internal.classic_mode': False}): 

6486 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=200, figsize=(6, 6)) 

6487 ax.set(xticklabels=[], yticklabels=[]) 

6488 ax.spines.bottom.set_position(('axes', -0.1)) 

6489 fig.canvas.draw() 

6490 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6491 

6492 targets = [ 

6493 [150., 24., 930., 11.111111], 

6494 [150.0, 1080.0, 930.0, 0.0], 

6495 [150.0, 119.9999, 11.111, 960.0], 

6496 [1068.8888, 119.9999, 11.111, 960.0] 

6497 ] 

6498 for target, bbspine in zip(targets, bbspines): 

6499 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6500 assert_allclose(bbspine.bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6501 

6502 target = [150.0, 119.99999999999997, 930.0, 960.0] 

6503 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6504 assert_allclose(bbax.bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6505 

6506 target = [150., 24., 930., 1056.] 

6507 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*target) 

6508 assert_allclose(bbtb.bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6509 

6510 

6511def test_tickdirs(): 

6512 """ 

6513 Switch the tickdirs and make sure the bboxes switch with them 

6514 """ 

6515 targets = [[[150.0, 120.0, 930.0, 11.1111], 

6516 [150.0, 120.0, 11.111, 960.0]], 

6517 [[150.0, 108.8889, 930.0, 11.111111111111114], 

6518 [138.889, 120, 11.111, 960.0]], 

6519 [[150.0, 114.44444444444441, 930.0, 11.111111111111114], 

6520 [144.44444444444446, 119.999, 11.111, 960.0]]] 

6521 for dnum, dirs in enumerate(['in', 'out', 'inout']): 

6522 with rc_context({'_internal.classic_mode': False}): 

6523 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=200, figsize=(6, 6)) 

6524 ax.tick_params(direction=dirs) 

6525 fig.canvas.draw() 

6526 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6527 for nn, num in enumerate([0, 2]): 

6528 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*targets[dnum][nn]) 

6529 assert_allclose( 

6530 bbspines[num].bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6531 

6532 

6533def test_minor_accountedfor(): 

6534 with rc_context({'_internal.classic_mode': False}): 

6535 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=200, figsize=(6, 6)) 

6536 fig.canvas.draw() 

6537 ax.tick_params(which='both', direction='out') 

6538 

6539 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6540 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6541 targets = [[150.0, 108.88888888888886, 930.0, 11.111111111111114], 

6542 [138.8889, 119.9999, 11.1111, 960.0]] 

6543 for n in range(2): 

6544 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*targets[n]) 

6545 assert_allclose( 

6546 bbspines[n * 2].bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6547 

6548 fig, ax = plt.subplots(dpi=200, figsize=(6, 6)) 

6549 fig.canvas.draw() 

6550 ax.tick_params(which='both', direction='out') 

6551 ax.minorticks_on() 

6552 ax.tick_params(axis='both', which='minor', length=30) 

6553 fig.canvas.draw() 

6554 bbaxis, bbspines, bbax, bbtb = color_boxes(fig, ax) 

6555 targets = [[150.0, 36.66666666666663, 930.0, 83.33333333333334], 

6556 [66.6667, 120.0, 83.3333, 960.0]] 

6557 

6558 for n in range(2): 

6559 targetbb = mtransforms.Bbox.from_bounds(*targets[n]) 

6560 assert_allclose( 

6561 bbspines[n * 2].bounds, targetbb.bounds, atol=1e-2) 

6562 

6563 

6564@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

6565def test_axis_bool_arguments(fig_test, fig_ref): 

6566 # Test if False and "off" give the same 

6567 fig_test.add_subplot(211).axis(False) 

6568 fig_ref.add_subplot(211).axis("off") 

6569 # Test if True after False gives the same as "on" 

6570 ax = fig_test.add_subplot(212) 

6571 ax.axis(False) 

6572 ax.axis(True) 

6573 fig_ref.add_subplot(212).axis("on") 

6574 

6575 

6576def test_axis_extent_arg(): 

6577 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6578 xmin = 5 

6579 xmax = 10 

6580 ymin = 15 

6581 ymax = 20 

6582 extent = ax.axis([xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax]) 

6583 

6584 # test that the docstring is correct 

6585 assert tuple(extent) == (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) 

6586 

6587 # test that limits were set per the docstring 

6588 assert (xmin, xmax) == ax.get_xlim() 

6589 assert (ymin, ymax) == ax.get_ylim() 

6590 

6591 

6592def test_datetime_masked(): 

6593 # make sure that all-masked data falls back to the viewlim 

6594 # set in convert.axisinfo.... 

6595 x = np.array([datetime.datetime(2017, 1, n) for n in range(1, 6)]) 

6596 y = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) 

6597 m = np.ma.masked_greater(y, 0) 

6598 

6599 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6600 ax.plot(x, m) 

6601 dt = mdates.date2num(np.datetime64('0000-12-31')) 

6602 assert ax.get_xlim() == (730120.0 + dt, 733773.0 + dt) 

6603 

6604 

6605def test_hist_auto_bins(): 

6606 _, bins, _ = plt.hist([[1, 2, 3], [3, 4, 5, 6]], bins='auto') 

6607 assert bins[0] <= 1 

6608 assert bins[-1] >= 6 

6609 

6610 

6611def test_hist_nan_data(): 

6612 fig, (ax1, ax2) = plt.subplots(2) 

6613 

6614 data = [1, 2, 3] 

6615 nan_data = data + [np.nan] 

6616 

6617 bins, edges, _ = ax1.hist(data) 

6618 with np.errstate(invalid='ignore'): 

6619 nanbins, nanedges, _ = ax2.hist(nan_data) 

6620 

6621 np.testing.assert_allclose(bins, nanbins) 

6622 np.testing.assert_allclose(edges, nanedges) 

6623 

6624 

6625def test_hist_range_and_density(): 

6626 _, bins, _ = plt.hist(np.random.rand(10), "auto", 

6627 range=(0, 1), density=True) 

6628 assert bins[0] == 0 

6629 assert bins[-1] == 1 

6630 

6631 

6632def test_bar_errbar_zorder(): 

6633 # Check that the zorder of errorbars is always greater than the bar they 

6634 # are plotted on 

6635 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6636 x = [1, 2, 3] 

6637 barcont = ax.bar(x=x, height=x, yerr=x, capsize=5, zorder=3) 

6638 

6639 data_line, caplines, barlinecols = barcont.errorbar.lines 

6640 for bar in barcont.patches: 

6641 for capline in caplines: 

6642 assert capline.zorder > bar.zorder 

6643 for barlinecol in barlinecols: 

6644 assert barlinecol.zorder > bar.zorder 

6645 

6646 

6647def test_set_ticks_inverted(): 

6648 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6649 ax.invert_xaxis() 

6650 ax.set_xticks([.3, .7]) 

6651 assert ax.get_xlim() == (1, 0) 

6652 

6653 

6654def test_aspect_nonlinear_adjustable_box(): 

6655 fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10)) # Square. 

6656 

6657 ax = fig.add_subplot() 

6658 ax.plot([.4, .6], [.4, .6]) # Set minpos to keep logit happy. 

6659 ax.set(xscale="log", xlim=(1, 10), 

6660 yscale="logit", ylim=(1/11, 1/1001), 

6661 aspect=1, adjustable="box") 

6662 ax.margins(0) 

6663 pos = fig.transFigure.transform_bbox(ax.get_position()) 

6664 assert pos.height / pos.width == pytest.approx(2) 

6665 

6666 

6667def test_aspect_nonlinear_adjustable_datalim(): 

6668 fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10)) # Square. 

6669 

6670 ax = fig.add_axes([.1, .1, .8, .8]) # Square. 

6671 ax.plot([.4, .6], [.4, .6]) # Set minpos to keep logit happy. 

6672 ax.set(xscale="log", xlim=(1, 100), 

6673 yscale="logit", ylim=(1 / 101, 1 / 11), 

6674 aspect=1, adjustable="datalim") 

6675 ax.margins(0) 

6676 ax.apply_aspect() 

6677 

6678 assert ax.get_xlim() == pytest.approx([1*10**(1/2), 100/10**(1/2)]) 

6679 assert ax.get_ylim() == (1 / 101, 1 / 11) 

6680 

6681 

6682def test_box_aspect(): 

6683 # Test if axes with box_aspect=1 has same dimensions 

6684 # as axes with aspect equal and adjustable="box" 

6685 

6686 fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots() 

6687 axtwin = ax1.twinx() 

6688 axtwin.plot([12, 344]) 

6689 

6690 ax1.set_box_aspect(1) 

6691 

6692 fig2, ax2 = plt.subplots() 

6693 ax2.margins(0) 

6694 ax2.plot([0, 2], [6, 8]) 

6695 ax2.set_aspect("equal", adjustable="box") 

6696 

6697 fig1.canvas.draw() 

6698 fig2.canvas.draw() 

6699 

6700 bb1 = ax1.get_position() 

6701 bbt = axtwin.get_position() 

6702 bb2 = ax2.get_position() 

6703 

6704 assert_array_equal(bb1.extents, bb2.extents) 

6705 assert_array_equal(bbt.extents, bb2.extents) 

6706 

6707 

6708def test_box_aspect_custom_position(): 

6709 # Test if axes with custom position and box_aspect 

6710 # behaves the same independent of the order of setting those. 

6711 

6712 fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots() 

6713 ax1.set_position([0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.2]) 

6714 fig1.canvas.draw() 

6715 ax1.set_box_aspect(1.) 

6716 

6717 fig2, ax2 = plt.subplots() 

6718 ax2.set_box_aspect(1.) 

6719 fig2.canvas.draw() 

6720 ax2.set_position([0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.2]) 

6721 

6722 fig1.canvas.draw() 

6723 fig2.canvas.draw() 

6724 

6725 bb1 = ax1.get_position() 

6726 bb2 = ax2.get_position() 

6727 

6728 assert_array_equal(bb1.extents, bb2.extents) 

6729 

6730 

6731def test_bbox_aspect_axes_init(): 

6732 # Test that box_aspect can be given to axes init and produces 

6733 # all equal square axes. 

6734 fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 3, subplot_kw=dict(box_aspect=1), 

6735 constrained_layout=True) 

6736 fig.canvas.draw() 

6737 renderer = fig.canvas.get_renderer() 

6738 sizes = [] 

6739 for ax in axs.flat: 

6740 bb = ax.get_window_extent(renderer) 

6741 sizes.extend([bb.width, bb.height]) 

6742 

6743 assert_allclose(sizes, sizes[0]) 

6744 

6745 

6746def test_redraw_in_frame(): 

6747 fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1) 

6748 ax.plot([1, 2, 3]) 

6749 fig.canvas.draw() 

6750 ax.redraw_in_frame() 

6751 

6752 

6753def test_invisible_axes(): 

6754 # invisible axes should not respond to events... 

6755 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6756 assert fig.canvas.inaxes((200, 200)) is not None 

6757 ax.set_visible(False) 

6758 assert fig.canvas.inaxes((200, 200)) is None 

6759 

6760 

6761def test_xtickcolor_is_not_markercolor(): 

6762 plt.rcParams['lines.markeredgecolor'] = 'white' 

6763 ax = plt.axes() 

6764 ticks = ax.xaxis.get_major_ticks() 

6765 for tick in ticks: 

6766 assert tick.tick1line.get_markeredgecolor() != 'white' 

6767 

6768 

6769def test_ytickcolor_is_not_markercolor(): 

6770 plt.rcParams['lines.markeredgecolor'] = 'white' 

6771 ax = plt.axes() 

6772 ticks = ax.yaxis.get_major_ticks() 

6773 for tick in ticks: 

6774 assert tick.tick1line.get_markeredgecolor() != 'white' 

6775 

6776 

6777@pytest.mark.parametrize('axis', ('x', 'y')) 

6778@pytest.mark.parametrize('auto', (True, False, None)) 

6779def test_unautoscale(axis, auto): 

6780 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6781 x = np.arange(100) 

6782 y = np.linspace(-.1, .1, 100) 

6783 ax.scatter(y, x) 

6784 

6785 get_autoscale_on = getattr(ax, f'get_autoscale{axis}_on') 

6786 set_lim = getattr(ax, f'set_{axis}lim') 

6787 get_lim = getattr(ax, f'get_{axis}lim') 

6788 

6789 post_auto = get_autoscale_on() if auto is None else auto 

6790 

6791 set_lim((-0.5, 0.5), auto=auto) 

6792 assert post_auto == get_autoscale_on() 

6793 fig.canvas.draw() 

6794 assert_array_equal(get_lim(), (-0.5, 0.5)) 

6795 

6796 

6797@check_figures_equal(extensions=["png"]) 

6798def test_polar_interpolation_steps_variable_r(fig_test, fig_ref): 

6799 l, = fig_test.add_subplot(projection="polar").plot([0, np.pi/2], [1, 2]) 

6800 l.get_path()._interpolation_steps = 100 

6801 fig_ref.add_subplot(projection="polar").plot( 

6802 np.linspace(0, np.pi/2, 101), np.linspace(1, 2, 101)) 

6803 

6804 

6805@pytest.mark.style('default') 

6806def test_autoscale_tiny_sticky(): 

6807 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6808 ax.bar(0, 1e-9) 

6809 fig.canvas.draw() 

6810 assert ax.get_ylim() == (0, 1.05e-9)

6813def test_xtickcolor_is_not_xticklabelcolor(): 

6814 plt.rcParams['xtick.color'] = 'yellow' 

6815 plt.rcParams['xtick.labelcolor'] = 'blue' 

6816 ax = plt.axes() 

6817 ticks = ax.xaxis.get_major_ticks() 

6818 for tick in ticks: 

6819 assert tick.tick1line.get_color() == 'yellow' 

6820 assert tick.label1.get_color() == 'blue' 

6821 

6822 

6823def test_ytickcolor_is_not_yticklabelcolor(): 

6824 plt.rcParams['ytick.color'] = 'yellow' 

6825 plt.rcParams['ytick.labelcolor'] = 'blue' 

6826 ax = plt.axes() 

6827 ticks = ax.yaxis.get_major_ticks() 

6828 for tick in ticks: 

6829 assert tick.tick1line.get_color() == 'yellow' 

6830 assert tick.label1.get_color() == 'blue' 

6831 

6832 

6833@pytest.mark.parametrize('size', [size for size in mfont_manager.font_scalings 

6834 if size is not None] + [8, 10, 12]) 

6835@pytest.mark.style('default') 

6836def test_relative_ticklabel_sizes(size): 

6837 mpl.rcParams['xtick.labelsize'] = size 

6838 mpl.rcParams['ytick.labelsize'] = size 

6839 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6840 fig.canvas.draw() 

6841 

6842 for name, axis in zip(['x', 'y'], [ax.xaxis, ax.yaxis]): 

6843 for tick in axis.get_major_ticks(): 

6844 assert tick.label1.get_size() == axis._get_tick_label_size(name) 

6845 

6846 

6847def test_multiplot_autoscale(): 

6848 fig = plt.figure() 

6849 ax1, ax2 = fig.subplots(2, 1, sharex='all') 

6850 ax1.scatter([1, 2, 3, 4], [2, 3, 2, 3]) 

6851 ax2.axhspan(-5, 5) 

6852 xlim = ax1.get_xlim() 

6853 assert np.allclose(xlim, [0.5, 4.5]) 

6854 

6855 

6856def test_sharing_does_not_link_positions(): 

6857 fig = plt.figure() 

6858 ax0 = fig.add_subplot(221) 

6859 ax1 = fig.add_axes([.6, .6, .3, .3], sharex=ax0) 

6860 init_pos = ax1.get_position() 

6861 fig.subplots_adjust(left=0) 

6862 assert (ax1.get_position().get_points() == init_pos.get_points()).all() 

6863 

6864 

6865@check_figures_equal(extensions=["pdf"]) 

6866def test_2dcolor_plot(fig_test, fig_ref): 

6867 color = np.array([0.1, 0.2, 0.3]) 

6868 # plot with 1D-color: 

6869 axs = fig_test.subplots(5) 

6870 axs[0].plot([1, 2], [1, 2], c=color.reshape(-1)) 

6871 axs[1].scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=color.reshape(-1)) 

6872 axs[2].step([1, 2], [1, 2], c=color.reshape(-1)) 

6873 axs[3].hist(np.arange(10), color=color.reshape(-1)) 

6874 axs[4].bar(np.arange(10), np.arange(10), color=color.reshape(-1)) 

6875 # plot with 2D-color: 

6876 axs = fig_ref.subplots(5) 

6877 axs[0].plot([1, 2], [1, 2], c=color.reshape((1, -1))) 

6878 axs[1].scatter([1, 2], [1, 2], c=color.reshape((1, -1))) 

6879 axs[2].step([1, 2], [1, 2], c=color.reshape((1, -1))) 

6880 axs[3].hist(np.arange(10), color=color.reshape((1, -1))) 

6881 axs[4].bar(np.arange(10), np.arange(10), color=color.reshape((1, -1))) 

6882 

6883 

6884def test_shared_axes_retick(): 

6885 fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 2, sharex='all', sharey='all') 

6886 

6887 for ax in axs.flat: 

6888 ax.plot([0, 2], 'o-') 

6889 

6890 axs[0, 0].set_xticks([-0.5, 0, 1, 1.5]) # should affect all axes xlims 

6891 for ax in axs.flat: 

6892 assert ax.get_xlim() == axs[0, 0].get_xlim() 

6893 

6894 axs[0, 0].set_yticks([-0.5, 0, 2, 2.5]) # should affect all axes ylims 

6895 for ax in axs.flat: 

6896 assert ax.get_ylim() == axs[0, 0].get_ylim() 

6897 

6898 

6899@pytest.mark.parametrize('ha', ['left', 'center', 'right']) 

6900def test_ylabel_ha_with_position(ha): 

6901 fig = Figure() 

6902 ax = fig.subplots() 

6903 ax.set_ylabel("test", y=1, ha=ha) 

6904 ax.yaxis.set_label_position("right") 

6905 assert ax.yaxis.get_label().get_ha() == ha 

6906 

6907 

6908def test_bar_label_location_vertical(): 

6909 ax = plt.gca() 

6910 xs, heights = [1, 2], [3, -4] 

6911 rects = ax.bar(xs, heights) 

6912 labels = ax.bar_label(rects) 

6913 assert labels[0].xy == (xs[0], heights[0]) 

6914 assert labels[0].get_ha() == 'center' 

6915 assert labels[0].get_va() == 'bottom' 

6916 assert labels[1].xy == (xs[1], heights[1]) 

6917 assert labels[1].get_ha() == 'center' 

6918 assert labels[1].get_va() == 'top' 

6919 

6920 

6921def test_bar_label_location_horizontal(): 

6922 ax = plt.gca() 

6923 ys, widths = [1, 2], [3, -4] 

6924 rects = ax.barh(ys, widths) 

6925 labels = ax.bar_label(rects) 

6926 assert labels[0].xy == (widths[0], ys[0]) 

6927 assert labels[0].get_ha() == 'left' 

6928 assert labels[0].get_va() == 'center' 

6929 assert labels[1].xy == (widths[1], ys[1]) 

6930 assert labels[1].get_ha() == 'right' 

6931 assert labels[1].get_va() == 'center' 

6932 

6933 

6934def test_bar_label_location_center(): 

6935 ax = plt.gca() 

6936 ys, widths = [1, 2], [3, -4] 

6937 rects = ax.barh(ys, widths) 

6938 labels = ax.bar_label(rects, label_type='center') 

6939 assert labels[0].xy == (widths[0] / 2, ys[0]) 

6940 assert labels[0].get_ha() == 'center' 

6941 assert labels[0].get_va() == 'center' 

6942 assert labels[1].xy == (widths[1] / 2, ys[1]) 

6943 assert labels[1].get_ha() == 'center' 

6944 assert labels[1].get_va() == 'center' 

6945 

6946 

6947def test_bar_label_location_errorbars(): 

6948 ax = plt.gca() 

6949 xs, heights = [1, 2], [3, -4] 

6950 rects = ax.bar(xs, heights, yerr=1) 

6951 labels = ax.bar_label(rects) 

6952 assert labels[0].xy == (xs[0], heights[0] + 1) 

6953 assert labels[0].get_ha() == 'center' 

6954 assert labels[0].get_va() == 'bottom' 

6955 assert labels[1].xy == (xs[1], heights[1] - 1) 

6956 assert labels[1].get_ha() == 'center' 

6957 assert labels[1].get_va() == 'top' 

6958 

6959 

6960def test_bar_label_fmt(): 

6961 ax = plt.gca() 

6962 rects = ax.bar([1, 2], [3, -4]) 

6963 labels = ax.bar_label(rects, fmt='%.2f') 

6964 assert labels[0].get_text() == '3.00' 

6965 assert labels[1].get_text() == '-4.00' 

6966 

6967 

6968def test_bar_label_labels(): 

6969 ax = plt.gca() 

6970 rects = ax.bar([1, 2], [3, -4]) 

6971 labels = ax.bar_label(rects, labels=['A', 'B']) 

6972 assert labels[0].get_text() == 'A' 

6973 assert labels[1].get_text() == 'B' 

6974 

6975 

6976def test_patch_bounds(): # PR 19078 

6977 fig, ax = plt.subplots() 

6978 ax.add_patch(mpatches.Wedge((0, -1), 1.05, 60, 120, 0.1)) 

6979 bot = 1.9*np.sin(15*np.pi/180)**2 

6980 np.testing.assert_array_almost_equal_nulp( 

6981 np.array((-0.525, -(bot+0.05), 1.05, bot+0.1)), ax.dataLim.bounds, 16) 

6982 

6983 

6984@pytest.mark.style('default') 

6985def test_warn_ignored_scatter_kwargs(): 

6986 with pytest.warns(UserWarning, 

6987 match=r"You passed a edgecolor/edgecolors"): 

6988 

6989 c = plt.scatter( 

6990 [0], [0], marker="+", s=500, facecolor="r", edgecolor="b" 

6991 )
